title: By far the best glucose level tracking app!
body: I used an old app for many years but eventually it became incompatible with latest iOS and I had to change. I tried 6 different apps and this one trounced the competition at the time. That was 3 years ago, and since then, the app has gotten better in many ways.
response: Hi! Wow, thank you so much for the great review. We are so glad you found us and that you have stayed happy with our products and service. Keep up the great work and we've got your back!

title: Fabulous app for all types of diabetes
body: First: premium version offers unlimited strips for $49 per month!!!!!
response: Thanks for the awesome review!! :)

title: Incredible App
body: I’ve been looking for an app like this for a long time. I had one similar a few years ago but for some reason they discontinued it. The best thing I can say is not only how easy it is to use but that it gives you a A1C average. I won’t know how accurate (close) it is until I go to the dr in late July for my Diabeties (type 2)check up.

title: Make tracking easy
body: New to being diabetic but this app tracks all my blood sugars if you have the Apple Watch it connected to their exercise app and keeps track of that you can log your food quite a heavy little program and if you want you can actually pay for the premium version which gives you unlimited test strips.
response: Hi! Thank you so much for the positive review! We are so glad you found us and that our app has been helpful for you.

title: Really good! Could easily be great.
body: I’ve been using this app (I pay for the Pro subscription) for over a month now to track my glucose, diet, supplements, and medication for gestational diabetes. I love that it integrates with my Apple Health so it automatically shows how much I’ve exercised, the steps I’ve taken, and even confirms my glucose readings as my Contour Next app also integrates with Apple Health. The automatically generated reports allow me to easily keep my midwife updated on my readings. My one and only complaint and the only reason I’m docking a star is this: why can’t I see my scheduled reminders and update them? Once you input a meal the app allows you to set a reminder. However, once it’s set it does not display that you’ve even set one anywhere within the app or allow you to edit it. I’d also love to be able to set a daily reoccurring timer within this app for my supplements and medication since I also track it here, but there’s none to be found. This would be a really simple add that would take this app up to perfect!
response: Thank you so very much for your awesome review! We're happy to hear the app has been helping you! We'll be sure to share your feedback with our developers, too.

title: I’m simply blown away
body: When I was diagnosed with pre-diabetes I went into data overdrive trying to get a hold of the problem and find a solution that works for me and my lifestyle. One of the key things I wanted was a solid, practical, and well designed tracker to help me paint a real world picture of my blood sugar daily. Of course the App Store doesn’t lack for applications and I downloaded nearly a dozen before settling on mySugr.

title: Easy to use; needs a lot of work
body: This app is really easy to use, which is great because I really don’t have any desire to spend my time recording this data. The layout is relatively streamlined and the ability to customize the fields is nice. In a free app. Since I paid for the pro version, I expect some better features:  1) the ability to get rid of that infuriating monster. Stress raises blood sugar. Stop annoying me with that thing. 2) The developer team could really use some help from people skilled at data visualization. The visualizations aside from the color coded entries are useless.  Add better graphs. 3) Add the ability to customize the tag tiles. And why the hell is menstruation on there?  The app knows I’m male. Spend a little time having the app respond better to user data. 4) Get rid of the advertisement on the report in the paid version.  And make it easier to get to the reports. 5) Take advantage of the fact that everyone with an iPhone expect visualizations to be better and more detailed when we rotate the phone. This app does nothing to take advantage of that capability.
response: Thank you so much for the feedback. We've had a chance to make some pretty awesome updates since October but we're always looking to improve and your suggestions will be passed on to our developers.

title: This is the best diabetes app ever! GET THE BUNDLE!
body: I was a diabetic with little control. I had given up. I ran into this app and it all changed.  I started using the app and it was fun. I wanted to use it. I bought the bundle that came with the Accu-Chek Guide Meter and UNLIMITED STRIPS. I started poking my fingers all the time! Wanting that control. My A1C was 9.6. I learned that with more knowledge came more control and an interest in a diabetic diet and lifestyle changes that have helped me noticeably lose weight. I can’t wait to see what my next A1C is. I’m sure it’s going to be a lot better. Oh I forgot. With the bundle comes a Diabetic Educator right in the app. Well worth the 49 dollar investment each month. No appointments needed just message her in the app. If you combine the bundle, a new meter lance and lancets all you can poke strips and an educator you’re making money to save your own life. This was the best medical decision I’ve ever made. Tame your monster! Get MySugr today!
response: Hi! Thank you so much for the positive review and for sharing about your experience with the mySugr Bundle! We are so glad to hear it has been such a great experience for you. Keep up the great work and we've got your back :)

title: Helped me drop my A1C from a 11.5 to 5.5 in six mos!
body: When I first got diagnosed it was really scary, and overwhelming  time. This app gave me something to concentrate on, it really helped me to log all of my eating and glucose records easily. Six months later now, things have gotten better for me and my need for logging every meal became less and less necessary and less testing too under Dr’s advice. I still enjoy doing a daily log in the morning, I enjoy the apps giggle when I log a 98 it’s a great way to start your day on a healthy step in controlling your sugar . I feel every newly diagnosed person should use this app, the free one was great, but the paid gives you the  photo option which I use to take a picture of my meter Incase I key it in wrong. Essentially this is a very important tool for recording your monitoring of your blood glucose and diet intake to help you lower your A1C.
response: Thanks so much for the awesome review and feedback!! The free version is awesome! The Pro version offers more logging options and is just $2.99 a month...less than a cup of coffee :)

title: Awesome app, pricey
body: We have enjoyed using this app to track our newly diagnosed t1 son. Over the three weeks we have been using it, we were able to earn the pro version by “taming the monster “ by logging 50 points worth of activity a day, for a week. This was not difficult as we logged every BG check, the insulin he received, what he ate and when, and how active to was. It has been a great help to us to have this format to do it. That hearing said, if we didn’t earn the pro version by our frequent use, there’s no way we would have bought the pro version ourselves. Everything with diabetes will nickle and dime you and this app is no exception. But we would have kept using the limited version indefinitely because it is totally adequate for our needs and we enjoyed that version as well. I’d recommend this app to anyone looking to keep good track of their or their child’s diabetes, especially before you are approved for and using your CGM or pump.

title: Great app, missing one convenience for gestational diabetes
body: This app is great overall. I’m using for gestational diabetes, and at my first meeting with a diabetes counselor, they were really impressed with the data report mySugr generated. I love that it syncs data automatically and wirelessly from my glucose tester.
response: Hi, thank you so much for the positive review and the very helpful information. We are glad you found us and have benefitted from using our application. We really appreciate the points you brought up for how to improve our app and we will definitely consider them as we are constantly working towards improving our product :)

title: Super easy, very grateful!
body: This app is crisply legible w/out the add-ons and is also free from advertisements! Had this app on my droid and have recently switched back to iOS and it performs exactly the same way between both systems. Type 1/ accu check- aviva; use basic edition of app. Love the update options but currently have great insurance and endrocrinoligical care. Bug issues and/or crashing/freezing have never been an issue between both systems. Incredibly grateful to have found this app as any other app I’ve used in the past will allow about ten logs before demanding a monetary upgrade. This app allows everything you need for free and saves unlimited logs since account setup. This tells me that whoever created this app finds that the health and well being of a diabetic means more than monetary success; otherwise they wouldn’t offer SO MUCH FOR FREE! Thank you thank you thank you!
response: Hi! Wow! Thank you so much for the positive review and all the positive feedback. We are so glad to hear that our app has been so helpful for you and that your experience has been so great so far! We are so happy to be able to offer such a great service for free and we are so glad to hear you appreciate it. Keep up the great work and we've got your back!

title: Thanks for making a more abundant and long life possible!
body: Really enjoying this app!! For the first time in 20 years my diabetes is under control!  My doctor LOVES the detailed reports! I love the ease of operation and entries. My eyesight is improving and I am losing weight! I do not feel hungry all the time and I have a tangible way of seeing my progress.

title: My most used app.  Love it.
body: I use this for tracking glucose, blood pressure, carb intake, and a1c.  I use another app to log my food and calculate carbs and I manually enter the carb values in mySugr.  I also use another app for tracking activity and for tracking my weight, and mySugr imports this data with no problem via Apple Health.

title: Better than paper
body: When my doctor handed me a piece of paper, I searched for something better and found MySugr. It tracks almost everything I need. I was surprised that my diabetes educator had not heard of it. I like that it estimates the A1C and the monster is cute. I like the idea of the package but I don’t need unlimited test strips-just the coach. Not worth paying extra for. To make it perfect, integrate with MyFitnessPal so I don’t have to enter meals in 2 places AND integrate with Freestyle Libre. This is such a need that I suspect you could charge a reasonable amount for it. I rarely use my Accucheck meter which does integrate. I would also like the ability to enter my own medicine not on the pre-defined list. The last thing I would like is the ability to rearrange or hide some of the icons. I rarely use some and have to go over 2 screens for those I use often. Great concept just keep improving.

title: Could be so much more useful
body: If this is the only app you use, it’s possibly adequate. If you track with multiple apps, it’s next to useless. CGM Data is not entered into the logbook other than as a graph. This means none of that information is used in estimating A1c, or other parts of the app. My meters (Accuchek Guide/GuideMe/Connect) often fail to import readings, necessitating multiple attempts. It would be easier to just keep a paper logbook, which is what this app is supposed to eliminate and make easier.

title: Great so far!
body: I’ve only been using this app for about a week.  It’s been working well, however I’m confused about the difference between the free version and the pro version. What are the differences between the two? What are the added benefits of the pro version? I Love how well it syncs with my AccuChek Guide monitor.  I don’t need a coach but that’s the only upgrade option offered to me in the app ... so I’m not upgrading because I’m afraid I’ll loose all my other data!  Also, I like the challenges, but they can be confusing to figure out.  Like the Greenhorn one ... I keep thinking I’m doing it correctly ... but then it’s telling me I’m failing!  Over all a solid app ... but user direction could be improved. I also love the reports feature and how easy it is to use the app — it’s nice that the free option is so robust too (as I mentioned above, I’d upgrade but I’m afraid of loosing my data).
response: Thanks for the review!! :) Here's a link where you can find the differences between the mySugr basic and pro versions https://www.mysugr.com/en/diabetes-app

title: What happened?
body: I’ve been using this app and the subscription service since my diagnosis in 2015. Overall it’s been an amazing app for my needs BUT in the last few months it’s become really buggy, unbelievably slow and crashes all of the time. I turned off it’s access to apple health thinking that would help as it often cant seem to  connect, but nope...still slow like 1999 dialup. It’s a dilemma  because I have so much data there that I don’t want to switch to a different app but it’s getting super frustrating to deal with a long wait for every field I fill out, then a crash that makes me have to fill it out all over again...all while my food is getting cold. I have a iPhone XR that’s caught up with all updates and this is the only app on my phone that seems to have a problem so I don’t think it’s my phone. I don’t know. I do love this app otherwise though so I’m hoping something gets worked out.

title: Excellent, but
body: This application is excellent. I can use it to track symptoms, meals, and activities throughout the day. I wish I could use it as my main app to have everything consolidated, but I’m disappointed that I can’t link the Fitbit app or the device, the Cronometer app, or MyFitnessPal app. I also wish that it had more options for people with hypoglycemia, such as reactive hypoglycemia or dumping syndrome. It only has different types of diabetes as options. I’m also great value to pay $49 for the premium membership considering the unlimited test strips that will pay for themselves many times over if you need to test multiple times a day. However only Accu-Chek is supported. The cheaper memberships are good too and reasonably priced. In general, this app is fantastic.

title: User friendly...for the most part
body: I was diagnosed only a few months ago so I knew next to nothing about diabetes let alone the management of it. This app is pretty straight forward, easy to use, and most importantly (to me), it doesn't take forever to enter your data. I like the feature that allows you to list medications and how many pills you're supposed to. The downfall of that feature is that it is not the easiest to set up and the instructions aren't clear. However, once it's done, all you have to do is scroll down to the medication and # of pills. By the way, if you have more than one medication,  you can't use the ”next” tab. You have to use the down arrow (to the left of the ”next” tab) then select the next medication. Overall, I would still recommend this app.

title: Luvin' it
body: Went with the AccuChek Guide meter w/unlimited strips bundle deal for $40 a month. Received my meter today, had been poking around the app prior to receiving it though, and so far, I'm delighted with it - meter connected easily without any issues at all, so bonus. Lots of good features to help recognize patterns and log everything easily - access to well known CDEs is a great bonus for the paid version of the app. Can't beat the deal offered, it's really helpful for those uninsured or under insured with high co-pays or tight restrictions on allotted amount of strips. The app is a great tool to use to aid in management of type 1 or type 2 Diabetes, and could even potentially be useful for those with hypoglycemia to help spot patterns with foods and drops.
response: Thanks so much for the great review! We're so happy to hear that mySugr is helping :)

title: A steal!! UPGRADE IMMEDIATELY
body: Two words: UNLIMITED STRIPS. The deluxe features are great for notating the day so you can notice patterns and the detailed reports look so nice. Im able to print them or email them to my doctor, and this app gives an estimated A1C once you give it enough data. They send you a Bluetooth enabled glucometer, which has simplified my life. If you have a continuous glucose monitor, mySugr links up with it. My diabetes educator is the first healthcare professional ive met with T1D just like me, she’s extremely accessible. I don’t feel judged for once and my diabetes is in MY control now. And i adore how the app lets me name my “diabetes monster”. Externalizing my condition like that really helps me disconnect from my diabetes and see it as a virtual pet i have to take care of. I CANNOT RECOMMEND THIS ENOUGH

title: Great way to track BG
body: I am absolutely horrible at tracking my blood sugars and keeping up with the numbers so every time I do get asked at the endo I either 1. Have missing blood sugars on the sheet for my 14 day report or 2. Have blood sugars but the times are sporadic so I have to eyeball when breakfast,lunch, and dinner was. With this app I literally have all the times and the exact blood sugars and I can even put in my bolus amounts for my meals, overall great app for being free and even if you do put a buck or two into it you get a whole lot more including graphs and labels for what you where doing when you checked, I would even dare to say it beats some of the sensor trackers in terms of graphing so long as you put your information in everyday, great app overall!

title: Keeps me on track
body: Great app that automatically sends my blood sugar readings from my Accu-Guide meter to my iPad and iPhone so that I (and my doctor) can easily review them at a later time without using up my meter’s battery.  Also love the fact that I can track my medications so that I will be able to see if I remembered to take them, especially my insulin since it can’t be tracked by a daily pill box.  Also love that I can keep track of other health items, like my weight, blood pressure, exercise log, just to name a few, all in one app.  Also love being able to share 2 week or 3 month report, showing an approximate A1c score if I’ve recorded enough blood sugar readings.  Wish I would have had this meter and app sooner.

title: Comprehensive, easy to use app for sugar mgmt
body: I needed to track my blood glucose and food..this is free and does way more than that, offering summaries, charts, and reports - those are a paid feature. I got a trial of the pro version and used it to print out PDF and Excel versions of my report, which I have to my endocrinologist. He was able to see the results easily. I’m continuing to use it. Since the data is all online, I can use the app on multiple devices and sync.

title: Would have been 5 stars, if more devices synced
body: ***updated review** They have added more brands of testing kits.  I also asked them to be able to delete test results en masse, instead of 1 @ a time. They agreed & said they will try to get that done.  For now,  customer service walked me thru deleting the app & old testing info (which did not want to delete) then reloading the app.  They still have not included my One Touch Verio IQ (which is only test kit I could get thru UnitedHealthCare). I like this app, & use it multiple times each day.  Being able to print out my reports is very helpful @ Dr visits. It is silly, but I enjoy the little green monster's sounds and sayings.  Also, I wish more diabetic Rx options were included (like Byetta).
response: Thank you for the positive review! I will include a link to our page that shows all the devices you can sync. You're suggestion for more Rx options is a great idea and will be passed on as we're always looking to improve :)

title: Awesome ... AWESOME... app Log it. Tame the Monster
body: I’ve seen many used more than a few but I have to say this one has kept me doing the tedious logging with all of the tame the monster fun. Cheers for making something a daily painful chore into fun. Once again I suggested to start logging my days for the next couple of weeks. I dreaded the paper trail options and felt apps weren’t gonna give enough. Yet to my amazement, I am so grateful to have stumbled upon this app. It has made a HUGE world of difference on my logging.  And my life living DB-MONSTER!! NOW I look forward in being the slayer in my own story and enjoy it most when I have tamed the BEAST.
response: Thanks for the awesome review!! We are so happy to hear that you are loving the fun features of mySugr!

title: Excellent Way to Monitor Your Blood Sugar
body: I love the MySugr app. It makes tracking my sugar levels easy. The indicators or what you ate, what you were doing, etc. make it really easy to determine what causes spikes and what helps level spikes out. The ability to have my sugar levels synced to multiple devices means that I don’t have to worry if I am somewhere with only a single device. When I get home, the information will synch and enable me toggle between devices.

title: No complaints
body: Honestly I have no complaints and it’s super easy to use.  Very self explanatory as well but even if it wasn’t I love how they have the support for any questions.  The best thing is that my son, the one we use this app for, can and does put in his own information quite often.  Last and I feel most importantly, when we were newly diagnosed and looking for a simple way to track all of the information the doctors would need, this app was suggested and when we showed it to the doctor he said this was the best one he had seen.  He said it was very comprehensive and loved the report capability which we still continue to take to his doctor at every appointment.
response: Thanks for the great review!! :)

title: Please make more “add on” options
body: The only option to get the pro edition is $50/month and includes unlimited strips. For someone that doesn’t have insurance that covers strips this option is fantastic. If you would make it so that the pro option is available without the unlimited strips that would be great!! Please oh please developer gods hear my humble request! Aside from that this app is the best thing that has happened to me since i was told i had to use insulin. Its great to hold yourself responsible for everything you eat, to keep track of your meds and everything else you do during the day. Oh and the little diabetes critter is so adorable and makes having to do this fun.

title: Good App
body: I was looking for a simple app for just tracking glucose levels and this was it. It takes awhile to get used to it but once I figured it out, it's easy. You just have to spend the time to log the info. Tip: if you don't have a BT monitor and have to log by hand, this app syncs with Health and if you have another device like a BP monitor, it's syncs and has the date already in there to record the BG. Just noticed recently that sometimes the app does not transfer over to Health. Check you data.

title: Clever, Fun, and Super Helpful!
body: This app is definitely designed with the type 1 diabetic in mind!  It is awesome. It allows logging of pertinent data, as well as excellent analysis. It gives continuous feedback about how you're doing. There are challenges to help keep you motivated and on track. And designers are open to suggestions. I love this thing. It's the best app I've found for logging diabetes data, especially if you're on a pump.  I've been using this for several months now, and I'm still using it!  It keeps me interested and provides useful data and analysis. I can print out PDFs for my CDE, which helps us fine-tune insulin for life. This app is so helpful!
response: Thank you so much for the positive review!! We love how much information can be logged and easily shared with your doctor :)

title: Maybe Don’t Charge Me
body: So this is an amazing app. It’s simple, straight forward and I definitely find the monster character adorable. However as someone who has multiple expenses a month on supplies, doctors and prescriptions it would be nice to not have to subscribe just to get the added bonus of using different traits per log. I understand charging for the personal help (which I do not need or want).
response: Thank you for the great review and feedback! The mySugr bundle is $39 a month which includes unlimited test strips as well as a certified diabetes coach. There is also a Pro version that's just $2.99 a month...less than a cup of coffee :) There are a lot of us that work here and also live with diabetes as well and can totally understand you about the costs, unfortunately, that is as low as we can offer at the time. We hope you're still enjoying the app and please feel free to reach out with any remaining questions.

title: Great app
body: This app more than meets my needs. I am borderline diabetic treating it with diet and exercise. This app easily allows me to post my morning daily blood sugar. More importantly, it makes me count my carbs and control my diet. I love that it allows me to push all the information over to the Apple health app. This allows me to combine information from my scale and other apps to give me a full picture of my health and activity. I would love it to provide me the A1C as stated but I only stick once a day. So evidently I don’t have the appropriate number of sticks to allow that to happen. That is the reason for four stars instead of five - if after several months of blood sugars I have enough sticks to allow the A1C average to happen then I would recommend five stars.
response: Thanks for the awesome review and feedback!! We're so happy to hear that the app is helping :) The estimated A1c does require three inputted readings a day to produce an accurate estimate. Keep up the great work and tame that pesky diabetes monster!!

title: Excellent "monster" manager
body: The logging system is clear, simple, and fresh - it allows me to see my averages and daily progress in many ways. I download  the app’s charts for my endocrinologist appointments, which stacks and visualizes data clearly for her to see what I’m doing every day that my pump can’t log (exercise, temp basal, etc). I use mySugr for 2-3 week bursts at a time to get my T1D back on track if I’ve been slacking. I have recommended it to several people and the occasional blog/Instagram post. Anyone who's motivated to change their diabetes regimen should try it!
response: Hi! Wow, thank you so much for this review and this great feedback. We really appreciate you taking the time to let us know what you think. We are constantly working on improving our app and will definitely take these suggestions into consideration as we do so. Thanks again and keep fighting! We've got your back :)

title: Absolutely the best diabetes tracking app!
body: I use this to track my son’s insulin dosing, meals, snacks, and activity. It syncs with the Dexcom and allows me to track patterns, adjusting insulin for various factors. I love that I'm able to search based on keys words I’ve entered (e.g. food or restaurant name) or the type of entry. I use it extensively and as a result his A1C results from his Endo have always typically matched that of the estimated A1C that the app shows you. Since diagnosis his A1C has decreased significantly, and although this is also a result of using the Dexcom and his pump, this app has also played a large part in it. Thank you for making an app that makes this horrible disease a little easier to manage!
response: Hi! Wow, thank you so much for your positive review and for sharing your story. We are so glad to hear our app has played a role in making this challenging disease a little easier!

title: MySugr Helps Me Keep T1D in Check
body: This app has been a game changer for my diabetes care. I am in my mid-20’s and have been diabetic since age 9. I’ve gone through different meters and pumps for years and currently I’m taking shots of Humalof with Tresiba as my long-acting at night. This app is a perfect way for me to see trends (such as going low in the mornings) so I can discuss them with my endocrinologiat and adjust my routine. I also am trying to limit my carb intake and mySugr helps with that as well. The layout is easy to use and the wealth of data from weekly to monthly to beyond is extremely insightful. Overall mySugr has been a fantastic tool in tracking my trends ans motivating me to to give myself the best possible care.
response: Thanks for the great review!! Keep taming those monsters!

title: Great motivator
body: I’ve tried a few different apps to keep track of my blood glucose levels, and this is by far the easiest to use. Other apps might have more features, such as a built in carb catalogue, but were so tedious and expensive I didn’t use it. This app gives you a number of features free, and if you use it will give you the pro version for free, at least for a while. If you decided to subscribe to the pro version, it is significantly cheaper than the other apps I’ve used. I am hoping that they start including more of the challenges, as I find those to be a fun way to motivate myself to stay on top of my sugars. Overall, great app and very helpful.
response: Thanks for the positive review!! We are so happy to hear the app is working well for you :)

title: Fun Diabetes App
body: I’m an insulin pump and continuous glucose monitor user, but unfortunately do not have a computer at the moment. So I was looking for an inexpensive app that would let me track my numbers, carbs, insulin, etc all in one spot and let me review it as I adjust my basal and insulin ratios.

title: Best App to Lower HBA1C
body: Ive been using Mysugar app for over a year now . My HBA1C was 7.4 when I started maybe higher its now 6.8 and working on getting down to 6.5 or lower. I love the different options it has to choose from especially Menstration as my ‘pre Monthly makes my sugar rise do to hormones it helps me track it before it becomes an issue

title: Very User Friendly
body: I just recently downloaded this app along with another as I hated the updates my last diabetes log app recently made. This app has won out and stands heads and shoulders above the others. I have wanted to get my 8 year old more involved in tracking his levels and meals and this Diabetes Monster app (as likes to call it) is just perfect. The use of the sounds on the little monsters when you feed the app is his favorite part, but the entry guides for noting readings, meals, insulin units, etc is so easy for him to follow.
response: Thanks so much for the great review! We love hearing that mySugr is helping kiddos living with diabetes :)

title: Diabetic care by caring diabetics
body: I have used this app of and on for about three years,now. Currently, I have it on my iPad which has more storage than my previous phones. The staff has always been wonderful and helpful as well as interested and encouraging in my journey. Even though they are based half a world away, it’s like having a support team right here at home, at work or whenever I need them. It may take a little time for a response, but it’s still quicker than getting one from my doctor. I’m not saying they are source of replacement, but their advice, so far, is right on que with my physician’s proxy.
response: Hi Sweettooth Jeff we love hearing positive feedback and are so happy mySugr could help! We're adding monster tamers to our customer support team currently to improve response time even more :)

title: An E log that can really help!
body: I am digital.  And I am fussy about using tech.  I like MiniMed pumps (yes I used others, always return, it works for me), Dexcom sensors and I like the simplicity of the verio sync meter.  Until my sugar that created a triple entry system to track numbers and trends.  Inefficient and wasteful!  I wrote to mysugr and asked them to "flip a switch" allowing my verio to apple health to register as blood sugars and integrate with DEXCOM.  Yippee!  One more step to set us mixed tech users free, get the bolus wizard information from MiniMed care link and it will all be on one location.   Cloud based and easy to share with family and medical personnel.  Works for me... Just might for you!  Thanks for the fast response to my request!
response: Thanks for the positive review! We're still working on more connections and data transfer too :)

title: Most comprehensive tracker
body: I had been looking for an app where I could not only record glucose numbers but also correlate with food, activity, meds and other factors. This is it!

title: Love the graphs, keeps me in check!
body: 23 y.o type 1 here. I started using this app after my a1c spiked. I wanted to get it back to where it was prior to that appointment, and no doubt this app helps keep me accountable and engaged. I don’t have the bundle or the meters that connect to the app, so I manually enter my numbers after I test. It’s a small step that takes a few extra seconds but so worth it.

title: Accurate
body: I have been through a few (lol) meters, whatever insurance paid for. I’ve had a lot of extreme roller coaster highs and lows due to over a 50 point difference in results (always clean hands of course) After a lot of research, I decided to take charge of one thing I could with T1D. MySugr makes it possible to test as often as I do (7-12) without paying a crazy amount out of pocket. I got 250 strips to start with and through the app they keep track of how many I averaged over a month and send me more BEFORE I run out. It’s awesome, my numbers may not always be unicorns (100) but it’s been so much better than before.
response: Hi! Thank you so much for the positive review and we are so glad to hear our app has helped provide a more affordable way for you to manage your diabetes.

title: Great app and great support team
body: I have been using this app over a month and am really hooked on it! Meter readings from my Accucheck instant are transferred seamlessly to my IPhone and  I am able to keep add food data that lets me know what kind of  foods raises my sugar levels more than others, I am adjusting my diet from what I learn!
response: Thanks for the awesome review!!

title: I love this app!
body: I have been a diabetic for 22 year and I am in my 2nd month with this app. It’s amazingly simple and the value is great. My diabetes specialist is very knowledgeable and non judgmental.   My entire life I have been hard to control which made me feel as if I was failingso I wouldn’t try. After leaving some major stress behind a year ago, my numbers are finally coming down. I have had to relearn what I can eat as I have avoided many foods for decades. I am very appreciative of the guidance. The help as I relearn how my body reacts to different situations and food has been phenomenal.   I highly recommend this service.

title: Tremendous Help
body: Recently diagnosed T2 and laughed at the idea of keeping a paper journal. Not that it’s ridiculous, but it’s not for me. Found this on a review of different BS tracking apps and tried it out. Very easy to use, great integration with Health and getting data from different apps (specifically my BP and activity). I quickly decided to go premium as it has a low price point and offers enough convenience that I feel it’s worth it. Keeps me motivated watching day over day, and week over week improvements to my health and numbers. Reminders are great! Give it download and check it out.

title: Easy and Fun to Use
body: I do love this app with many different features to help keep track of glucose readings, carb intake and glycemic index readings plus how your feeling, notes and challenges. The note feature come in so handy as I use it to remind me of things to tell my doctor as well as issues that affect my sugar readings. Wish it would connect to my hospital records or to my doctors records so there would be an overall reading to compare with the doctor A1c reading. But overall, best little Diabetic app for me. Wish this type of thing was around when I was diagnosed Type 1 50 years ago.

title: Newly Diagnosed Type 2
body: This app is engaging and really helps keep your attention to your numbers. I’m trying to get my glucose down to my target range; and completing challenges and gaining points for my attention to detail keeps me motivated to make necessary changes in my day to day choices. Also the little monster companion is adorable and he keeps me on my toes! This app makes a grueling process (weird to say but actually...) a little fun! It also syncs directly with my Accu-chek Guide via Bluetooth so I don’t have to manually enter my values. I would recommend this app to anyone with diabetes!
response: Thanks Crystal, we loving hearing that mySugr is helping! Keeping track of all that data can be tedious and boring and we're so happy that it's more fun now :) Keep taming that pesky little diabetes monster!

title: Life changing
body: I am normally horrible at keeping track of my diabetes. Thanks to mysugr that has changed for the better. I love this app and my little bugger(mysugr monster).
response: Thanks for the positive review! We love how easy it makes tracking too :)

title: Super app!
body: I was diagnosed with T2D last year, my daughter and I were looking for something to make it easier to keep track of things without having to constantly write it down. We found my sugar and it’s literally changed my life! With this it’s easy to see where I am how my progress is, after four months I had blood work done the A1C was exactly what the app said! I have recommended this app to my doctor who now recommends it to his patients! I can’t say enough good things about it, nor do I have a complaint! Thank you for making this it’s helped me so much!
response: Thank you so much for this awesome review!! A second thanks for the recommendations :) We love hearing positive stories like yours. It sounds like you have great management and are taking the right steps. Keep up the good work and tame that pesky diabetes monster!!

title: Simple and User Friendly
body: This App has proven to be a great tool in a time where the new normal of having a child diagnosed with Juvenile Diabetes can overwhelm any family. It has allowed the entire family to easily track and document the day to day trials and tribulations of “the new normal” assisting in keeping sugar levels consistent throughout the day. It in effect reduces the potential of elevated stress levels and tensions that could occur between the supporting care givers to the child. It’s user friendliness also allows for  younger family members to actively participate and foster independence. We’ll done.
response: Hi! Wow, thank you so much for sharing and for the positive review. We are so glad you have found our app helpful as you and your family adjust to this "new normal". We've got your back!

title: Great overall health tracker
body: Let me start by saying I am not diabetic, but I have some fasting hyperglycemia and high blood pressure, and I have been working on losing weight. I love having one app where I can track meals, blood pressure, weight, exercise, and my blood sugar when I do check it, which is about twice per week just to make sure I am on the right track with my diet. I do wish you could choose “prediabetes” as your diabetes type. Also for future updates it would be neat if you actually earned something by completing challenges or earning points, like custom colors or badges.
response: Hi! thank you so much for the positive review and the great suggestion! We will definitely keep this in mind as we are constantly working towards improving our app and making it the best it can possibly be :)

title: A diabetes app that doesn’t bug you
body: I recently got diagnosed and trying to discover a diabetes app that doesn’t try to force a subscription on ya was extremely important to me. I’m already freaked out about diabetes, not having features shouldn’t be a worry too.

title: Helped me get my sugars under control
body: Can’t recommend this app enough. It has honestly helped me get my blood sugars under control the past month. I’ve had it on my phone for a while but never used it till my a1c went up to 13.7. Hoping to see a decrease in it at my next appt. only thing I wish this app did as well is be able to scan barcodes of food or be able to put exactly what I’m eating into the app so that it’ll count my carbs, protein, and other nutritional data into the app with each meal so that I don’t have to manually enter in the data.

title: Second review
body: Still a solid app. Love the sound effects after each entry when saving, keeps me motivated in wanting to keep the entries up to date to see what the next sound will be. Would like to see an ability to edit some mistakes I’ve made (double entries in location) and the ability to organize the activity icons without the app being so touchy, over reactive when moving them around, or just not being responsive at all at times.

title: Love the Bluetooth
body: I had gestational diabetes 5 years ago and I have it again. I no longer have to log my blood sugar in a logbook to show my doctor. I can just do the blood drop and I don’t even look at my meter. I just do it and shut it and can rest assured that my phone captures it. Then I can look at it at my leisure.

title: Incredibly useful!
body: I have really enjoyed using this app. I have recently been diagnosed with type two diabetes and this app has been essential in my day to day life. It is simple to use, syncs directly to my glucose meter (which I love!), and the graphic, including monster mascot, add a touch of fun to an otherwise unpleasant circumstance.
response: We are super happy to hear that you find our app helpful 💚 Thank you for your review and your valuable feedback, we really appreciate it! If there is anything we can do for you, just let us know at support@mysugr.com. Have a wonderful day!

title: I love this app!
body: I switched to mySugr after the app I was using became unworkable. I absolutely love it! I helps me keep me track my blood glucose with lots of tools a bit of humor. The little monster is so funny and helps me keep my perspective when I get a higher reading (fortunately not too often) and it says “It happens”. I went for the pro version to get the exported charts. I have been testing daily for almost 3 years now so I don’t keep that detailed a diary to get 50 points a day. If I had started with this app I could have aced the pro challenge to get it free.
response: Thanks you so much for the great review! We love hearing that mySugr can help :)

title: LUV mySugr
body: After turning 65, and after nearly 40 years surviving and thriving with type 1 diabetes, I’m encountering increasing balance challenges. I’m loving mySugr and how easy it is to log to my heart’s content! Back in the late 70s when I developed diabetes my Dr. shamed me for being “obsessed” and “anal” for wanting to keep detailed blood sugar, food, and activity logs. We’ve come a long way in 40 years, eh! The only downside I’m finding is that mySugr doesn’t seem to link to / with my Contour Next meter. Would be perfect for me if it did link!
response: Thanks so much for the positive review! Time flies and we had the chance to integrate a lot of cool stuff.

user_name: S u p e r D u d e
title: Love this app!!
body: As type one diabetic, the daily upkeep of blood sugars and insulin dosing can be extremely stressful and overwhelming, but logging everything with mySugr has changed our lives! It’s easy to track all of our diabetic info and make adjustments when needed based on both live graphs/info and long-term reporting. The app is very user friendly and intuitive, and most of all... drumroll please... you’re not going to believe this... it’s kind of fun! Thank you, mySugr team, for creating something so wonderful. You have really, truly made a difference.
response: Woohoo!! We love hearing that our users are having fun with the app :) Thanks for the great review!!

title: New to diabetes
body: I found out I have type 2 diabetes 4 months ago. I’ve been losing weight and learning how to manage it. This app, along with Myfitnesspal, my Bluetooth connected scale, and OmronWellness BP cuff, are the patient generated data side of my overall healthcare regimen. Having the ability to track my glucose easily and have that data integrated with other vital statistics is really helpful. I don’t use all the features of the app, because they are redundant to the others, but you could conceivably do it all in this app if it interfaced all the devices.
response: Thanks so much for the awesome review!! One of the things that we love about the app is being able to use as much or as little of the features as works for you. We're so happy to hear that you're enjoying the app and it's helping you manage your diabetes care :)

title: Too many bugs with Apple Health
body: This app is great, with the exception that it has too many bugs with apple health. The responses that the developer gives me is for someone who is a rocket scientist at this. I finally quit paying for the full version. I always tell myself that I will pay for the full version when it finally has no bugs with apple health. But it has been around three years and no changes. I also wish that I could connect somehow with my freestyle libre 14 days. Every day it gives me the message that I need to restart my phone in order to get it to work correctly. The funny thing is that I restart my phone every single day at the end of the day regardless and it still happens.
response: Oh no! We're so sorry to hear you're having trouble syncing your phone. There may be a solution...as always, monstrously fast.

title: Wonderful and helpful organization and cute theme!
body: I’ve always had so many problems with keeping up with my bloodsugar when I was younger and the lack of organization and planning in my life made it even harder. I can safely say that having this app for a couple of years has impacted me 100% for the better and it’s the only diabetes app I could recommend to any type of person! Cute theme, not overly complicated, easy navigation and a large selection of factors from exercise to just feeling stressed. I absolutely recommend this app!

title: My sugr experience
body: I love this app .... although i havent been diagnosed with diabetes just yet ....i had a diabetic scare with a blood sugar reading of 497 ......i quickly attacked this problem by tracking my progress on this app.

title: Best App Ever
body: I love this app it is so easy to keep up with my sugar levels and my diet. Also love the reminder alarm to check my sugars.  The only reason I did not give it a 5 star is because I wish it would link to other apps like, MyFitnessPal or just merge to my Fitbit that would make it awesome. Also when adjusting time for my reminder To check my sugar I am not able to adjust the time if I don’t immediately add the alarm when I log my food or last BS. Other than that I love it. I love the fact that I got a whole kit about over 150$ worth of lancets for a very affordable price. I love this app.
response: Thanks for the review!! We are always looking for ways to make the app even better :)

title: User friendliness of the App
body: I just started using this App a few weeks ago and I like it a lot. Is has all the items I want to keep track of regarding my health. The trend line and average A1C tracking is awesome. Just one thing. I also like the other items the App is capable of but I think $49 a month is a bit steep. I could see $20 a month or perhaps an outright $250 per year. The additional information is valuable, just not at $49 a month. Overall though, the App is the best I’ve seen that does what I, and perhaps other diabetics need it to do.

title: Love this app
body: I love this app in that it helps me keep track of what I’m eating and what reaction I have afterwards and while I’m not accountable to anyone else,  it makes me more accountable to myself - more mindful of what I’m eating. I love being free to test as many times as I want using the MySugr bundle and not having to worry that I’m gonna run out of test strips and then not test when I think I should. I recommend this app to any of my friends that are diabetic and to anyone on my diabetic team wherever I am living or working (I travel for my work).Thank you MySugr!

title: All glucose entry’s gone
body: I was in love with this app a couple of days ago. I just needed something easy to track my levels and to see a graph of my habits on the pill and off the pill. I woke up this morning with all my entry’s gone expect maybe 3-5 for the last couple of months of manual entry. YIKES!!!! I logged out and back in thinking there might have been an error but no data came back. The only things I see for each day is either “before meal” with no glucose level or my input of the pill.... there isn’t a way for me to go to settings and click SYNC or BACKUP and I feel there should be a manual way to push a sync button or backup button so this does not happen again.  I can’t say that I will be using this app anymore sadly..
response: HI! Can you please write us to support@mysugr.com ? Then our customer support Team can take care of it :) Thank you and sorry for the troubles!

title: Great app for my daughter
body: My daughter is 9 years old and this app has really made tracking easy and fun. She gets excited tracking her blood glucose levels and getting an over all a rage of her readings. Being able to share her readings with other family members really helps us not worry about her so much, because we get alerts every time she logs her readings. This really helps put our minds at ease because we get alerts several times a day. If I could give more stars I definitely would.
response: Thank you so much for this awesome review!! Many of us working here at mySugr have been living with diabetes since childhood too and wish we would have had an option like this years ago. We're so happy to hear that the app is providing peace of mind for you and your family :)

title: My saving grace!
body: I came across this app when I was struggling to pay for test strips every week. At first I wanted to log just to see how much I was testing so I could buy my supply once a month. Well the mysugr bundle popped up and at first I thought “this can’t be real, it can’t be $40/month for unlimited testing supplies.” So I looked more into it. Well it’s real my fellow diabetics. I recommend mysugr logging system as well as their mysugr bundle. It’s literally lifted the weight off my shoulders. My only fear is they will stop offering the bundle!
response: We're so happy to hear that the mySugr Bundle is helping!! Thank you for the awesome review, we have no plans of stopping the bundle anytime soon :)

title: Motivational monster
body: The theme of mySugr is tame your monster! I’m 60 years old and I still find the little monster icon  giggling every time I input my blood sugar very funny. I’m sure it’s meant to  motivate us to continue. It works! That said the app is free and provides a very detailed and easy to use accounting of health indicators and tracking medications. it’s a full featured diabetes companion. I’ve used it over five years and  find I keep going back to this app
response: Hello! Wow, thank you so much for this great review. We are so happy to hear you have been using our app for over five years and that we continue to be your #1 choice :) The monster still makes us here at mySugr laugh as well and sometimes that is just what we need to give us that extra push to keep managing our own diabetes monsters! Thanks again for this great review and we hope our app continues making you smile.

title: Everything you need for diabetes management
body: Fantastic app! Only improvement I would suggest is the ability to create and track custom fields. For instance, there's a field to track carbohydrates, but not protein or sodium. The meter provided at the higher service level is accurate and easy to use. The included test strips are a great deal. I love being able to see my meals, glucose trends over time, plus an estimated A1C. All awesome features.
response: Hi! Thank you so much for the positive review and awesome feedback! We will definitely consider it as we are constantly looking for new ways to improve our app. You are right the challenges are just fun ways to earn extra points! :)

title: Thank You!
body: This app has helped me manage my diabetes for several years now. My doctors have been impressed by it and have come to love it too. I’m looking forward to when endocrinologists start to integrate this technology into their treatment plans. It’s so much more convenient than a traditional paper log and charts everything for you to see trends more easily! There are times that I’m not sure if all our modern technology is a good thing, but this app proves that it can really contribute to a person’s well-being. Cheers!
response: Hi! Thank you so much for the positive review and all your input! We are so glad to hear you and your doctors have been so happy with our app. We definitely agree that this is a good part of technology! Thanks again for all the kind words :)

title: One of the best diabetes track apps I’ve tried yet.
body: Like the review says. Due to pharmacy and insurance changes, I’d found myself searching for a new app, since the old app worked only with the model that suddenly wasn’t covered.
response: Thank you so much for the awesome review and feedback!! Insurance can be such a pain :(

title: Great app!
body: (Edited to add) Issue resolved with help from MySugr support. Thank you!! The app bundle is worth it!! Our family is going through a huge transition with insurance, for the time being, not an option. Our T1D is young so we have to test often. It’s awesome to have an easy app to input everything from blood sugar, activities and ketones! Our LO loves to feed the monster and make it “talk”.

title: MySugr makes Life Sweeter
body: Being a diabetic for 20 years+ has been an overhanging rain cloud in my life. The condition brought much change and pain too. I had given up trying to keep up with the monitoring, recording the medicine does is was a lot. MySugr app made a huge difference by just reducing the time and effort for recording  my stats daily. Also the  app brought information and online support right in my hands.  It is a valuable tool than made each day a lot easier to face with diabetes.  Thanks MySugr for leaving a sweet day in my life!

title: Near-perfect blood sugar app
body: I’ve been using this app on and off for several years and recently came back to it and now use it daily. It’s simply the best and easiest blood glucose app available for the iPhone, and I say mostly because it makes it so easy to input data and the feedback is incredible and even entertaining. (Sorry for the run-on sentence). The only thing that stops me from giving it five stars is that I wish it did Bluetooth syncing with more devices. I really like my Contour Next One meter but for the life of me I can’t get it to sync.

title: Great tool for managing Diabetes!!!
body: I never could have delt with managing my Type II Diabetes without the help of great apps like MySugr and MyFitnessPal. I love how I can get and save PDF files of my blood glucose history, digital records are easier to keep on file. If only MySugar could include a carb tracking database tool like MyFitnessPal also so that I only had to use 1 app to look up and record my carbs and blood glucose numbers all in 1 app, it would be so much easier to stay on track with limiting my carbs.
response: Hi Dells85, I'm so glad that mySugr is helping you! There is a place to track carbs and other food in the app, but no connection with My Fitness Pal yet.

title: Very Good Diabetes Logging App
body: I use this app as part of the bundle with meter and test strips. I use it every day. Overall it is very good, but not perfect. The logging is fairly easy, but there is no way copy logs that you use every day like meals. The coaching is pretty neat to have access to a CDE. The app stores all of your insulin and carb and pump info. The app also integrates with Apple Health so you can bring in Dexcom CGM data, and I can also bring in my Strava activity data.
response: Thanks for the awesome review!!

title: My personal review and appreciation
body: I was recently diagnosed with type 1 diabetes, and as a 13 year old boy I find it easy to cope with as I dont have too much on my mind on where or what to do with my numbers. So I see this as a wonderful way to manage my numbers, and I give my full appreciation to the mySugr team, and I hope for them to even have a system where your numbers are automatically done for you. As it would be simple, the person just has to put in the ratio of their insulin doses
response: Thank you for the great review! We love hearing that mySugr can help :)

title: Keeping me On Teack
body: Before this MySugr App I had no real routine for tacking my tests or results.  Now I have a commitment to test 3 times a day and a way to easily track my progress.
response: Hello! Wow, thank you so much for the positive review and for sharing your experiences :) We are so glad to hear our app has had such a positive influence on your diabetes management!

title: Thank you!
body: I’ve been through 2 days of trying to get accu-chek software to work. My battery went out on the A-C Connect. Pharmacist said to get A-C Guide but I had to change-strips and just paid$126. Pairing worked once and stopped. Lost all data. Geek  SQuad triedBZShan but said I might need a newer phone, I have iPhone 6. I have new meter and no pairing worked.

title: Easy and accurate
body: I downloaded the mySugr app because it was highly rated, positively reviewed, and synced well with my blood glucose meter.

title: Makes diabetes management easier
body: When I was diagnosed and started getting the lessons on how to manage my diabetes it felt like an insurmountable task for a guy like me. This application not only makes it easy to log and track your ups and downs, but simplifies communicating your log to your healthcare provider as well (with Pro subscription). The team behind the app really care and have made the feedback and support process simple too.

title: Diabetic & insulin user
body: I really enjoy using this app it is much easier than having to write everything down in a log book, I have been using it for awhile now and I will definitely continue to use it and I have told others about it, like my cousin that was diagnosed with diabetes as well she was having problems getting log books and I mentioned this app to her and helped her get it downloaded to her mobile device and now she uses it as well.

title: Fun, detailed logging; genius, supportive coach
body: This app makes logging worthwhile because you can include details that matter in a fun and easy way.  When I upgraded to Pro and started interacting with my coach, the life value of this app went to a whole other level of awesome.  I found the suggestions and feedback from my coach invaluable!  It means a lot to have someone so accessible to give feedback on your data and to troubleshoot with regarding all kinds of potential solutions.
response: Thank you so much for your review! We are so happy to hear you have been enjoying our app. Keep taming that monster!

title: Life So much easier
body: With this all being so new to me getting this on to my routine has made everything so much easier I can’t imagine doing this without it I’m able to keep track of everything Blood sugar weight blood pressure my medicines my vitamins even my activities and how I’m feeling at any point.  I keep going back to prior meals using it again with the numbers already calculated just everything about it. Don’t think about it just download it!

title: 5 Stars but could use 1 improvement
body: This app is an excellent way to track blood sugar and get an estimated a1c!  I recommend it to other Diabetics, any chance I get!  I do wish that there was an option saying 1 hour after meal and another saying 2 hours after meal which is how a lot of Diabetics check their blood sugar.  There is an “after meal” but it doesn’t say how long.  Other than that I absolutely love this app and so does my Grandson who gets a kick out of the little giggles lol
response: Thanks so much for the positive review and your feedback! We're always looking to improve and your suggestion will be passed on to our developers :)

title: Easy, good data at a glance
body: This is our go to diabetes logging system for our T1D toddler. Easy to use and the data analysis is helpful. I like the expanded pump logging options like temp basals. No one else has quite figured out how to provide a simple and effective way to track all the variables that go into managing T1D as well as you have. An added feature could be to export data to Glooko or other clinical data analysis tools. Thanks for your part in reducing the burden on our family, great app!
response: We love hearing that mySugr is helping kiddos too! Thanks for the positive review :)

title: Getting back on track
body: I really like this app because I can make notes on what I eat, if I’m checking before/after a meal, exercising, etc. My only wish was that there were more options for exercise- I think there may be with the paid version. There are also challenges to keep you motivated to track! I have struggled with finding out where I can improve to get my a1c down without a sensor (I personally do not like them) so this is helping!
response: Thank you for the great review and feedback! We love hearing from our users :) There are more options in general with the Pro version, but the free version works great as well.

title: Such a great motivator!
body: I have had type one forever it seems like, and I find myself loosing interest in keeping track of everything from time to time. But this app is an AMAZING motivator! It makes it fun to keep track of you food, insulin usage and so much more. My endocrinologist is so happy with the insight and I couldn’t be happier myself! I also invested in the pro that includes a tester that uploads my test straight to the app! So great! Could go on and on how much I love this. I recommend it for everyone!
response: Thank you so much for the awesome review and recommendations!! A lot of us that work here have been living with diabetes for many years as well, and know that feeling. The app offers such a great insight into all the factors that affect blood sugars and it motivates us diabetes dinosaurs to track more :)

title: Words Cannot Describe Gratitude...
body: I was diagnosed T1 almost one year ago and it has been an unbelievable battle. As I was browsing the endless hordes of “sugar” apps; I can across this gem. Bless all of you involved with the progressive development. I wish I could hug you all. The interface is simple enough to use. The little monster is great. Even my nieces and nephews ask if I’ve fed it yet. From my family, you have given me back to them. I cannot express truly how thankful I am.
response: Wow, thank you so much for this incredible review and for sharing your story. We are so glad you found us and we've always got your back!!

title: mySugr
body: I’ve been using mySugr since 2014 when I was seeing my pediatric endocrinologist. She recommended that using this app would be much easier than writing my logs on paper, especially since my phone was ALWAYS in my hand! It makes keeping track of my sugar a lot easier, more fun, and the “diabetes monster” is really cute. I recommend this to anyone who absolutely hates writing your sugars on paper or if you’re struggling to remember to write them down at all. 😊
response: Hi! Wow, thank you so much for the positive review! We are so glad to hear you are been so happy with mySugr for such a long time! We definitely agree, keeping track of data on  the app is much better than writing in a paper logbook!

title: So helpful
body: I've been a type 1 diabetic for 26 years, and have always struggled with controlling my blood sugars. Never been able to consistently keep a log of my glucose readings either.. I'd start one, stay with it for a week or two, then fall off the wagon. This app has helped me keep track of everything! I feel better than ever! Why did it take me so long to find this app haha.

title: A little bit of everything!
body: This is one of the most complete apps for monitoring all aspects of my health. I have used several different apps trying to find the best to monitor my blood sugar, weight, carbs, meal time and meds.

title: MySugr Tracker Reports
body: I use the Fitbit App to track my activities, MyNetDiary to log & track my food and carbs in and that is passed to MySugr via Apple Heath. I also track my glucose, blood pressure & weight using MySugr. MySugr Premium allows  me to create reports displaying my carbs, excercise, glucose, insulin, blood pressure, excercise & meals on a single timeline graph to see how they interact together. I have type 2 diabetics & I am working to get off disbetic medication. MySugr allows me to gather information & review it to try to achieve this goal.

title: Used to be great, now just crashes
body: I thought maybe it was just that I needed to update, because every time I tried to open the app, it would appear for a second or two then close.
response: We are so sorry about the issues you have been experiencing. Please write to us at support@mysugr.com and we'll look into this for you right away!

title: This is Great!!!!!!
body: Love this app. Love that I don't need pen and paper to keep track anymore. When I need to do an update I just take out my phone and enter it. Love the sound affects to they are cute.
response: Thanks so much for the positive review! I'm glad to hear you're still happy with the app :)

title: Useful and Informative
body: I am not diabetic, but have, all my life, had the condition of reactive hypoglycemia. There is some evidence that this tends to lead to prediabetes, which seems to be what is occurring with me. I am finding the mySugr app to be very helpful in tracking glucose levels, and, hopefully, I can do what I can to prevent it. The mySugr app is well designed and rather amusing, with the Sugar Monster. My point is that the app is useful even for those of us who are trying to avoid developing diabetes, if we can.
response: Thanks so much for the positive review! It looks like you're being super proactive in tracking and monitoring what you can, and we're so glad mySugr can help. Keep up the great work and continue taming that pesky diabetes monster :)

title: Very Helpful
body: Been using this app a little over a week now and am really liking it! Loving the many features it offers for keeping on top of blood sugar, carbs and insulin. The little monster is a fun touch too and though I haven’t, I like that you can turn off the monster sounds. The one feature I do wish it had and the reason I took off one star is because I would like to see an active insulin feature. Please add this feature in the USA and my four star rating will change to 5 stars. Nice app!
response: Thanks so much for the positive review and feedback! An "on board insulin calculator" is a great idea and will be passed on to our developers. We're always looking to improve and love hearing from our users :)

title: Ha Helped Me Organize When Starting New Insulin
body: The program has allowed me to document and reflect on my specific foods in response to pre-blood sugars, basal insulins, and regular insulin pre-meal.   Easy to document!   Love the ability to “correct” my hyperglycemic responses to specific food-not by taking extra regular insulin or increasing my basal insulin, but by changing my behaviors such as fast foods and food selections.   Look forward to correlation of my lab and projected glucosalated blood sugars when I see my physician in October.
response: Thank you so much for the positive review and feedback!! It seems like you have awesome control and are working hard to tame that pesky diabetes monster :)

title: Love the app!!
body: I just recently discovered this app. It even accessed my old blood sugar logs and integrated them into it. So I can see a better picture of where I was and where I am now. I love it when the sugar monster laughs and it encourages me to keep logging in and extra happy when my sugar is in the green!!! Thank you for developing this. I still could use a little more help on some of the applications it does but that comes with playing with the app more.
response: Thank you so much for the GREAT review! We love the sugar monsters laugh as well :) We definitely encourage you to keep playing with the app but always feel free to reach out to our support team at support@mysugr.com or visit our support page on our website https://support.mysugr.com/hc/en-us for specific questions.

title: Love thus app
body: I have been so happy I found this app! Others I tried were not user friendly and didn’t provide as many options for tracking. Easy to enter a information and the option to log in a lot of different things... not just blood sugar. I can enter ketones too! App will show bolus vs long active insulin ratios easily and how much number deviate. I can’t even print out log to take into Dr appointments.
response: Hi! Thank you so much for the positive review :) We are so glad to hear you have been so happy with all the different components of our app. We love being able to track everything and easily share information with our care teams!

title: My sugar Or One Drop
body: Good app for tracking blood glucose.  Since I dropped my pro membership I think I have lost some of my report capabilities.  I would love to come back but I need to track my carbs and other nutritions.  Since Loose It is no longer allowed to communicate with my sugar it doesn’t help me. Is there any plans to bring back this communication? Or, is there any other way to get the carb/nutritional information from the Health app into my sugar. It’s up to you guys wether I can come back. Right now one drop does allow loose it information to come over. However I like your reporting a little better. Please let me know for I’m about to choose one drop or one sugar for a meter/strip program.
response: Hi David! Thank you for reaching out. You are correct, the PDF and Excel reports are exclusively part of the Pro or Bundle membership.

title: Easy for a beginner to use
body: I was diagnosed about a month  ago and was keeping track of everything on paper.  After a few weeks it was a pile of paper sitting around and it was hard to see trends.  I read about mysugr app on a Facebook diabetes page for beginners and people were raving about it.  I have used it for two weeks and I find it super easy to use and see how my body reacts to different foods.  Highly recommend.

title: Love this App
body: I have been diabetic for over 20 years and HATE logging my readings on paper. I use a meter that doesn't connect to doctor's offfice machines as it is a cheap meter (all I can afford!). I found this app and not only is it easy to use, I actually love the fact I can store info in my old phone and have it transmitted to my doctor! I don't have to write days and times, it logs it for me and I can add items like before or after meals, activity, etc. I love it!!!

title: My mySugr Story
body: Love the mySugr bundle. I wish I had just started with the bundle and not even messed with insurance/prescriptions. It would have saved money!

title: Great tool for diabetics
body: This app has helped me log my blood sugars, habits and food to track my progress. As a type 1 it is hard to find somewhere to store all the data and factors involved in affecting my diabetes, but this is the best App I’ve come across so far. My only comment is about the food logging. I wish there was an easier way to look up, enter, and add up all the carbs for a meal. If it integrated the food logging more seamlessly, it would help with tracking what foods work better for your control.
response: Thanks for the great review and feedback! Your suggestions will be passed on to our developers as were always looking to improve :)

title: My short journey
body: I love this app the is my second time with gestational diabetes and I wish I would have had this the first time it helps me feel sane and in control of my situation everything is right there in front of me black and white. I only went 24 hours with the free version it’s worth every penny to go pro! I did the 2.99 a month because I only need it a few months but if I had type 2 $40 for a year is worth it
response: Thanks for the positive review!!

title: Wow, excellent customer service!
body: One the rare occasion that I had an issue with an update, my request for assistance from the MySugr Support Team was answered amazingly quickly with the precise help I needed to remedy the problem.  Outstanding! The app is very easy to use and provides a lot of helpful graphics within the app to help me maintain control of my health.  I perform advanced analysis outside of the app, so I especially appreciate how easy it is to extract the data. Well done, MySugr team!!
response: Thanks so much for updating your review! We try hard to have top notch customer support and we're so happy you're back to loving the app :)

title: Good App... so far
body: Very happy with app... so far. It’s only been two weeks and I need a full 30 days to decide. So far, so good. After 30 years of being an insulin-dependent diabetic, my A1C was creeping up over 8. Doc says we need to get it back to low 7s, so I needed an app to track blood glucose and carbs, something my FitBit doesn’t do. Too bad it can’t all be on one app. This app is fairly intuitive, and I’m sure there are many features I don’t know about, yet. Very satisfied.
response: Hi! Thank you so much for the positive review. We are so happy to hear our app has been so useful for you. Please do not hesitate to reach out to us if you have any questions or want support around any part of our app. We are here for you and we are glad you found us!

title: Cheryl
body: Love this app. I kept a hand written log for four years. This is so much easier.  I use this app in conjunction with the CarbManager app in an effort to be as accurate as possible. I test my sugars 3 - 5 times a day on most days. This is helping me to be accountable in my efforts to bring my A1C into the 5% range. My recent labs show my A1C is now 5.5!!!
response: Thank you so much for your feedback, we really appreciate it! It's great to hear that you're accomplishing your goals and making more!

title: Auto fill
body: Love the fact that the app can get my readings directly from my meter, no more remembering to log the results. Wish I could remove auto reading though. Had someone else use my meter and automatically added to my readings. Next time I will add something in the notes section. No if I could get my meds there too it’s be great. Need to find the help section to see what other options are available.

title: Like & Use this app
body: I’ve been using this app for a while now.  It was recommended to me by my t1d daughter-in law as easy to use so I’ve decided to try it.  So far it seems easy.. but I haven’t explored everything it can do yet. But one thing I really like is the fact that when I add things on my iPhone, it also registers on my iPad Pro app.  Helps keep tract of my numbers as when I had my iPhone stolen a year ago June, I’d lost all my blood sugar history.
response: Thanks for the positive review! We think the app is pretty easy and can make keeping track of all your information way more fun. If you need help navigating the app please feel free to reach out to our customer support team support@mysugr.com with any further questions.

title: Easy to use
body: I made an excel spread sheet to keep all my information but this app makes it ten times easier. The machine putting in the blood sugar levels over blue tooth is outstanding. It keeps track of how much and when I take insulin. The many different types of food and the carbs associated. I’ve only been using it for a couple weeks but I’ve completely switched everything to this app and have abandoned my excel sheet.
response: Thanks for the positive review!! We are happy you are loving the app :)

title: It’s basic
body: It’s a basic program for tracking your glucose, nothing great or special for free. If you’re willing to pay an arm and a leg for the full deal of extras is just crazy and not worth it to me since I only check my level once a day, first thing in the morning. Maybe if I was one that had to check my levels a few times to several times a day, it might be worth it. Plus there is no features to allow you to repeat your meds or other information from the previous day to speed up your entries. Also supposedly it should link with your Apple health, but it doesn’t. There’s no way I’d spend $50 a month for this app.
response: Thank you so much for your review and feedback, we really appreciate it.

title: The Little Queen
body: It’s taken me some time to figure out how to navigate (where editing and adding previous day’s results is concerned) but I am getting the hang of it. I would like a have a reminder for adding my results (I don’t need reminders for testing, but logging has always been an issue for me). ALSO, it would be GREAT to have this app talk to my iPhone AND Lose It app.

title: Was awesome, now it’s awesomer
body: I’ve loved the mySugr app since it’s introduction they’ve continuously worked to improve it and now with the team work with Accu-Chek bringing the reality of unlimited testing to us at a very fair rate I don’t think I could be happier unless I wasn’t diabetic. As a pumper being able to monitor blood glucose trends as often as I like is wonderful makes five tuning insulin rates even easier and more accurate over time. Keep up the great work.
response: Thank you so much for the awesome review! Keep up the good work and tame that pesky diabetes monster :)

title: I appreciate this app
body: The only t1d app that I like using. I've tried so many. If you have an accu chek monitor it's a must because you really do t have to do much it keeps track and logs all you bg checks for you and imports it straight from monitor to the app. On my less lazy days I love going in and documenting more and seeing all my progress. A huge thumbs up from a young lady who has been t1d since 1996 this is by far my favorite app so thank you!!!
response: Thanks so much for the positive review! We love hearing that mySugr is helping :)

title: Helpful app
body: Although I am a non-insulin managed Type 2 Diabetic, this Site has been very helpful for me. It helps me to keep up with my glucose levels during the day, encourages me to make healthier eating choices, helps me to track my meal choices and exercise regimen. For me, it serves to help with accountability and it helps my doctor and dietician to see my lifestyle choices and make adjustments where necessary. I also like that I can track my metformin dose.
response: Thanks for the great review!!

title: Happy I Upgraded!
