body: I used the free version of the app for 3 months and was totally satisfied with it. After visiting a nutritionist, I decided to do the first upgrade in order to track more information. Wow! I love being able to take pictures of meals, track med doses, more descriptions and taking notes on mood, foods, changes. It’s great. Although I maintain my meal tracking app to get carb count on food items, I don’t mind transferring that info into mySugr. Thanks!

title: Very helpful application
body: I use this app to keep track of my blood sugar level and it helps that I can add notes if I failed to take my medication or had a late night snack that could have effected my test. I also like the fact that I can link my other “health” app’s to show in addition to blood sugar levels this app will also show my blood pressure results also for a example in the basic version of this app.

title: Need a way to manually enter date and time
body: There needs to be a way of manually entering time and date so that you can go back and add readings. I have taken readings and forgotten to log the data immediately. Then after eating or taking my

title: Life Saving App
body: This app has changed my life.  I never want it to go away. I thought my doctor had prematurely diagnosed me with T2D and was disappointed.  However, it’s been an eye opener. I think this app should be mainstream and marketed to anyone who can’t lose weight.  It would be nice if insurance paid for diabetic supplies for those in the pre-diabetic range so that they could use this app to determine their blood sugar levels and know what the wrong diet can manifest.

title: Great app!
body: I have been using this app to keep track of my glucose and I love that I can mark meals or activity so when I see my doctor I don’t have to think too hard as to what was going on with that low or that high glucose level. I would absolutely recommend this to more diabetics! I love that it offers “challenges” as well to encourage checking or trying to stay in range. Love love love this app! The “diabetes monster” is so cute too!

title: Great app
body: I wasn’t sure this would work for me, but within 3 weeks I loved it so much that I upgraded to Pro.  Too easy to use and keeps me motivated to reach goals.  I use another app to help me log my carbohydrate intake and easily put the totals on the MySugr app.  With the upgrade, I got a BG monitor that sends the results directly to the app via Bluetooth every time I test!  So convenient!  If you’re struggling to tame your Diabetes Monster, this is an excellent tool.
response: Thanks for the great review!! Keep taming those monsters!

title: Great tool!
body: I’ve been a diabetic since I was 9 months old. I have always haaaated logging my sugars. This app makes it kinda fun! The layout is nice and something about it makes me feel super accomplished when I have an “all green” day. I really enjoy that I can type in what food I ate and such. Knocking off a star because the upgrade is just sooo pricy. It’s expensive enough being a diabetic. I wish you could opt out of the test strips and just purchase access to the app add ons. Otherwise it’s perfect!

title: Strips and tracking
body: I happened to come upon this app when searching for the best value for my money when buying my strips.  As a new diabetic, I eat to my meter and test as often as 10 times on some days as I learn what food spikes me.  With their unlimited strips bundle cheaper than the manufacturers own prices and an app with coaching, it was a win all around.
response: Thanks for the positive review!! We love hearing that mySugr can help :)

title: JOY!
body: I've been Type 1 for 33 years and this app is one of the most helpful things I've used yet, right up there with the invention of Humalog, Lantus/Toujeo, and CGMs! The graph is so helpful; I email it to my doc at check-up time, so it's great for her too! Fabulous customer service—that’s what finally convinced me to write this review. She was so helpful when I didn’t understand something. I will recommend this to every diabetic I meet! Thank you! 🙌🏻
response: Wow, thank you so much for this review! <3 We are so honored you think so highly of us. We are so glad you had a good experience with our customer service team and we really appreciate all the recommendations! Thank you.

title: CDE recommended for a reason
body: As a type 1, my diabetic educator suggested I start logging my carb consumption and BG etc with this specific app now that I’m expecting. Logging an entry is very easy and easy to edit, plus you can enter as much or as little info as you please. Very easy to share reports with her and my doctor as well so they know I’m taking this seriously (and they don’t have to decipher my handwriting). I’m using a Freestyle Libre to test my BG FYI.
response: Hi! Thank you so much for the positive review. We are so happy to hear our app has been helpful for you. Haha! Yes, not having to decipher handwriting is definitely a plus.

title: Easy to use, thankfully
body: I’m new to having type 2 diabetes, but needed an easy way to log information so I could keep track of everything. This has made it incredibly simple for me and makes it really easy to show my doctors what I’ve been up to. I like the customization ability on the data entry page and also the drop down past day info feature.

title: Helpful tool
body: I like all of the options they give you to enter factors you want to keep track of, and you can simplify those fields by removing them if you want.

title: MySugr Review
body: Not so easy to set up and understand. The Accu-Chek Guide Me meter lost connection with my iPhone and I haven’t figured out how to reconnect it. That should not be so difficult! And I don’t want to waste a lot of time on the phone with a stranger. So, don’t call. I’ll just go back to my old way of keeping track. I don’t want to be part of some world-wise study that someone else will use to get rich. If you want that kind of data from me, then start paying me. I’m doing all the work on this end. I will be deleting your app. Goodbye.

title: Not so enthralled
body: I really really like the app except for one thing – I don’t really like having an app laughing at me when my sugar is high. I get it- you’re trying to motivate people. Unfortunately some of us just aren’t able to get extremely tight control without experiencing constant hypo events. I figure if I can get it in the ballpark most days I’m ahead of the curve. Maybe do away with a little animations and sound effects and just let people log their blood sugar.

title: It's cheerful and easy to use
body: I'm newly diagnosed with type two, and I'm still fighting that horrible feeling that comes with knowing you have this overwhelming problem to face.

title: Great for keeping track
body: I like the picture function most. I keep track of everything to show my doctor because portion size is my enemy. I was keeping a weitten log but this will be way more accurate at my visit because the dr will actually be able to see my plates.

title: Awesome app, just one suggestion!
body: I just downloaded this app, and I’m already in love with it. By far, it’s the best app for tracking sugars that I’ve used.

title: I love this app!
body: I use this app every single day to track my blood sugar and I love it. The reports you can generate for your own use or to give to your doctor are great. Decisions on adjusting insulin doses need to be based on facts not guess work!
response: Thanks so much for the positive review! We're so happy to hear that mySugr is helping :)

title: Nice tool for diabetics
body: I just got diagnosed with diabetes last week. Currently my doc only wants me to test prior to breakfast and 2hrs after my biggest meal. This app makes it super easy to record my sugars. The little monster makes me laugh especially since I also suffer from major depression. My only complaint is there doesn’t seem to be a way to record what I’ve eaten, only the number of calories. Other than that, I think it’s worth downloading
response: Hello! Thank you so much for the positive review and for sharing your story. We are so happy that our app has made you smile. In regards to entering what you have eaten there is a spot right under "Carbs" where you can enter "Meal" and "Food Type". Please let us know if you are having trouble finding these entries, we are happy to help here or on our support line at support@mysugr.com.

title: So simple! Great motivator
body: MySugr helps me keep track of everything I do and it allows me to stay on top of my diabetes. There’s so many easy tools in the app to personalize each entry. Of all the sugar journal apps I’ve tried, MySugr always wins hands down because of how simple it is and how motivating it is. Never laggy, either. Which is super nice, as well as the fun colors and concepts that makes diabetes a little more enjoyable.
response: Hi! Wow! Thank you so much for the positive review :) We are so happy to be your favorite! Thanks again for the great review and keep fighting the diabetes monster! We've got your back.

title: Nice!
body: I’m loving MySugr. I’ve been all over the board with my blood sugar. Since my monitor is linked with MySugr all I have to do is use it. Many times I wouldn’t have paper or a log book so it never worked out and many times I just gave up. Now even if I’m out my phone and MySugr communicate and no hassle.

title: So far so good
body: I’ve been using this app for a couple weeks now. I love how easy it is to use. Looking forward to learning more about the app as I go. The interactive “monster” is just cute enough that I could see kids enjoying using this app to track their levels.... a bright spot in what might otherwise be a trying time. I’m actually having fun trying to “tame my monster” :)

title: Great tool
body: By far the best diabetes app out there. This app imports my glucose levels directly from my AccuCheck meter every single time without issue unlike the actual AccuCheck app that I had to mess with about every other time and re-pair the meter and my phone at least 3 times a week. mySugr strangely has never had a single problem and I’ve only had to pair my meter once, and that was the first time.

title: Love the Giggles, But...
body: For the yearly price this app is far too expensive to just be cute (do we really need all those cutesy icons which I rarely use?) and it’s basically easy to use, but sorely lacks in convenience. I refuse to become a Subscriber again until I don’t have to use another app or go online to calculate my carbs in order to calculate my Bolus dosing - that’s a real pain when I’m typically short on time and am trying to keep a tighter rein on my BG. Having to retrieve my carb info elsewhere is why I won’t give this app five stars

title: Good for tracking
body: I’m just starting to test each morning. I like the app because it makes it easy for me to track my numbers. Also, you can track how you are feeling, if you’ve eaten or exercised, etc. Once you start recognizing how your body is feeling, after you’ve eaten, or based on what’s going on in your day, you can get a better sense if you are high, low or normal.

title: Thank you for helping me take control of my life
body: This is a great app. I recently became diabetic and this app has all the tools to help me manage and monitor my condition. I use it in conjunction with myfitnesspal to monitor what Im eating and the carb impact to my blood sugar. I decided to upgrade to the premium version so that I can fully record my meals with photos. I pray this tool helps me to put my diabetes in remission. Great job to the developers, thank you 🙏🏾

title: Overall great service, wish I could be more detailed without upgrading
body: Useful for dietician visits, way easier alternative to keeping a journal (in my opinion), extremely easy to use, wish it had more options or at least a notes section to be more detailed without paying (which I understand is how the world goes round but do I really have to pay to tap a button that I did housework or tried a new food?)

title: Great, but bigger fonts needed
body: I love the app. Still learning to use it, but the important part, recording my blood sugar is incredibly simple. The only problem I have is that the font size can’t be changed (I searched). For people with diabetes, who are prone to vision problems, a bigger font would’ve been a better choice. An option to choose our own would be even better. But otherwise, I’m happy. I seriously recommend it!!
response: Thanks so much for the positive review! You can change the font size in your phone setting and it should reflect in the app. I would suggest making it larger and trying bold. If you still need help feel free to reach out to our awesome customer support team support@mysugr.com and they should be able to help you in no time :)

title: I can’t thank you enough
body: I just found out about this app from my dietician. I can’t thank her enough. With my crazy busy schedule and life, it was hard for me to manage or remember to input my numbers and track what I eat. This app is amaaaazing omg. Only complaint I have is that I wish the numbers would input and auto sync faster. My device is brand new but it seems to lag. I’ll have to keep turning it on and off. That’s why I gave it 4 stars
response: Thanks for the positive review!! I'm sorry to hear you're having problems with syncing your machine. If the problem persists please feel free to reach out to our awesome customer support team support@mysugr.com and they should be able to fix the problem in no time :)

title: Log
body: For the beer lol.  It is a handy app makes it much easier for my doctor to keep up with my readings he can scroll down and see them much better than paper logs and reading my tester. I like the meal logs myself. The app makes it much easier for me to track what makes my sugars pop up when food is our enemy but one cannot live without food or carbs
response: Hi! Thank you so much for the positive review :) We are glad it has been easier for you and your doctor than using paper logs, we think it is a lot better too!

title: Nice record keeping app
body: I have the accuchek guide meter and this app helps keep all the data together, plus I can export it to excel. (It should also work as a generic logbook for any glucose meter I suppose.) Also it has helped me track my carb intake and insulin dosing to see patterns on a single screen, which is nice too. Wish they would unlock the Bolus Calculator for the US, but I guess the FDA needs to ‘ok’ that. Keep up the good work!

title: Comprehensive and easy to use
body: I have been using MySugr for several mont. Very pleased with its straightforward entry. The integration with Apple health and other health apps is what makes this app more useful than other logging apps.
response: Thank you so much for your feedback and great suggestion, we really appreciate it!

title: Exporting reports to my care team is a breeze!
body: This app is so easy to use and the graphics make it easy to follow what different entries are: eg color-coded blood sugar values to track when in and out of range, a color for insulin entry, a color for carbs. This applies to both the graphics in the trending setting and in the reports. I can’t think of anything I would add to improve the ease of use of this app.
response: Thank you so very much for your review! We're happy to hear you enjoy the app!

title: MySugr
body: I like the app, it’s simple to use and is quick to add an entry.  For enhancements I would like the ability to add a note to the entry I made for items that are out of the norm and connect to my Fitbit where I’m tracking my calories in/out and physical activities.  I’d also like to be able to use the microphone to make entries especially when I forget a few days in a row, that part is time consuming when you have 15 entries to make.
response: Thanks for the review!! We love feedback and are constantly looking for ways to improve.

title: Easy to use
body: Im new to diabetes, I was diagnosed about a month ago. Starting using this tacking app to help manage my diabetes. Liked it so much I picked up one of the test meters so I could download to the app.

title: Have to pair frequently.
body: In October 2019, I discovered the software and it was a very useful tool at the beginning. As times goes on, for no reason, the data cannot connect with the iPhone from the meter. It kept dropping and had to pair them again and again. I had contacted the customer service many times and before the customer service responded back to me, I was able to pair the meter again. Now I have been trying to pair the meter with my phone in the last few days with no avail even changing the meter with new batteries.
response: Hi there! Please send us an email at support@mysugr.com we would love to help you get your devices paired once again.

title: Pictures & Notes
body: Love that mySugr allows  note taking & pictures. This is great for identifying which food had a stronger reaction to blood sugar spikes. Also when on the go can look back at picture of portions and more accurately log. Also helps remember so I’ve become more accurately intuitive of carb affects on my blood sugar.

title: Useful and super User-friendly
body: I’m really appreciating the way this app is making my complicated journey with Gestational Diabetes easier. Logging my numbers is simple and fast and I appreciate the options to customize my entries by noting wether the reading was fasting, post meal, etc., while also being able to list exactly what I ate. I am pleased enough to upgrade. Thanks so much for a useful tool.
response: Thanks so much for the positive review!! We're so happy to hear that the app is helping you through gestational diabetes. Keep up the good work and we wish you the best with your pregnancy :)

title: Good way to record blood sugar
body: I have used this app for a few weeks now and it’s nice way to record my blood sugar. I am newly diagnosed so anything to help with this process is good. My machine records this but it’s nice to graph what’s going on and to see what I have ate or what exercise is doing what to my blood sugar. Do wish there was a way to see the entire graph and run different reports but bed app I’ve found so far
response: Hi! Thank you so much for the positive review and we are so glad you found us! Thank you for the great feedback as well, we will definitley keep it in mind as we are constantly working towards improving our app :)

title: Can’t login after update
body: I would give this at least a four star but cannot use app after latest update. Also it could be a five but after the first week or two of having app I cannot get logged in online either. Keeps telling me to delete my cookies. I even tried on a brand new laptop and no luck. It was the first site went to and gave same error.  Would gladly give app five stars if could use it since it has helped get my diabetes in check.
response: Hi, thank you for the review and we are so sorry to hear you are running into this issue. Please reach out to our support team at support@mysugr.com and we will be more than happy to help you get back to taming your monster ASAP!

title: My sugar
body: Like a lot but I had some problems connecting my meter to my sugar But today I was able to enter data by myself but I think this good for me. We’ll see!

title: Very good app
body: It keeps all of the info I want in one place. The charts are very good to more easily assess your trends. The one thing I wish is that it took data from Apple Health and reported the info I manually enter back to Apple Health. I have other apps that use the same data. It would be nice not to have to manually enter the data multiple times. But this app is the best I have found for organizing and visually presenting the data.

title: Sugr that helps my blood sugar
body: This app says it’s easy and fun. It actually is both. More than that, after only the first two weeks, it’s helping me see how to impact my A1c in a positive way. After trying dozens of more complicated apps, I’ve finally found one that links to my meter, uploads fast as a breath, and gives me the chance to track actual important information. Sweet Sugr!!

title: So Cool
body: I was not sure at the beginning but it so nice to have a record all located together.  As a diabetic recognizing patterns with my sugars really is key to regulating my eating and foods.  This allows me to easily see several sugar reading all together do seeing patterns in sugar spikes or dips is awesome. And it’s just an added bonus to have blood pressure handy too. Great for giving information to your doctor.  Just a Great App !!

title: Satisfaction Critique
body: I just use the basic app and record my tests in AM before breakfast and basically fasting all night. My evening testing is two hours after dinner. My ability to track and record results has resulted in my ability to stay below 7 for the last 10 years and without meds. Your app has provided me with that ability. It helps ME to stay in control of my monster. So thank you!!!

title: Very good. Needs a couple of improvements
body: So many great things to say. Love that it integrates with the Accu-Check Guide, but I’ve now switched to the Freestyle Libre and it will not integrate. This is a huge drawback. If I have to pay for pro now I probably won’t I’ll just switch to Freestyle‘s app.

title: Really good but could use some features
body: I really love this app. Even though I love this app I think it could use some features like more meters that it could connect with I have a ACCU-CHEK Aviva plus and it’s the only one my doctors office could connect to so it kinda hard to get to do it every time . Also if you can you add on to it a desktop version so we could make it more convenient for people who can’t always get to there phone.

title: I love this app
body: I actually use this app every day to track insulin, carbs, and food and can see how well I’m doing (ok, sometimes I see how poorly I’m doing). The charts are key for me—thank you. I need that visualization. I used to keep a notebook with the same info but no charts and couldn’t understand why I had so much trouble figuring out what was going on. Love your app, love you all for making it!
response: Hi! Thank you so much for the positive review. We are so glad to hear our app has helped you, seeing your data is so important!

title: Just right.
body: I love this app. I have avoided recording my blood sugar for most of my adult life, in part because of the poor options available that were easy, intuitive and helpful in how they displayed information provided. I am continually appreciative of the way this app is set up and I hope you continue to update it and keep it available to diabetics like me.

title: Needs coffee
body: Having been diagnosed with gestational diabetes, this app has been a great help in tracking my glucose. However, it needs a way to track coffee consumption! I can mark soda or diet soda as part of my meal, but not coffee. Definitely need that adjusted. I will also go for days with no issues, then suddenly I have to re-pair my phone and meter every time I take a reading. It only takes a minute or so, but it can get frustrating.

title: Great tool for diabetics
body: I love this log app. It helps me keep a record of my blood sugars and the amount of insulin I take. The only thing I would change is that I would like to see the app be more compatible with monitors such as the Verio or one touch. Also it cannot import the data from my Dexcom CGM4. I hope that when the 6 comes out it will be compatible with that.

title: MySugr great app! Easy to use.
body: Tracks almost everything I need. Works well with Apple health. Only missing things are pulse & blood 02 level. I can’t find a way to add medications to the original list I made. Not show stoppers but would be great if I could. Wish list items: would be great to track grams of sugar, sodium & fat with meals. ability to get EKG & Blood Pressure data directly from Kardia app.

title: Great tracking app
body: Tracked manually and entered data in spreadsheet to run analysis. Love the ease of use and intuitiveness of the app. And, having a coach to look over the data with fresh eyes is a plus for giving feedback and suggestions to reach my goal of no meds. I’ve three months to lower my numbers significantly. Using this tracker, I see immediately what the trend is and can identify triggers.

title: My sugr helped me take control.
body: I’m a post operative new diabetic patient on steroids that caused or instigated sudden onset of type two diabetes. So no classes no warning. I went to sleep (anesthesia) normal and woke up a full blown diabetic. This app helped me learn to keep a log of not only my glucose and corrections but of many other metrics important to my recovery. The little chuckling icon was annoying at first but eventually became a comfort as I learned to keep my glucose in check.

title: Awesome app
body: Great app to keep your sugar checks logged in every time you get a reading. You can add what you ate. How much medication you took. What activities you’ve done, if your just doing your morning check or whatever type of day you just hit an icon that’s already there and it shows what your doing , what your eating, what times. PERFECT app! Highly recommended!

title: it was good until
body: This app is excellent, if been using it for a month but now the bolus calculator isn't working and it is forcing me to pay. When this was recommended to me I was told I could pay if I wanted the extra options like the "fasting" or "traveling" but now I have to pay 27$ for a calculator?? It didn't even say anything about a free trial. I'm very disappointed. At least tell us before hand this wasn't a permanent thing and that we'd have to pay for it.

title: Helpful for a future college student
body: I’ve been using this app for the past few weeks and it’s really helped me to track everything and make sure I’m putting in carbs. I really enjoy this app and I know it’ll help me keep on track when I’m in school away from home in a few weeks instead of letting everything go crazy.

title: Great app
body: This app helps both my husband and I see my son’s numbers with every reading. If one of us is at work and the other is watching my two-year-old T1D, the person at work can also see the numbers and relax a little.  It’s also helped me see a pattern for when his numbers might be consistently high or low, and easily log food intake, too.
response: We love hearing that mySugr helps kids living with diabetes too! Thanks so much for the positive feedback :)

title: Best way to keep track of sugars
body: Great way for me to keep track of my sugar levels, over a day, week, or month, etc.

title: Couple of minor items
body: Everything is looking great with the app so far. Sometimes when I have to edit I’m unable to put the numbers in for long acting insulin by tapping on the field. I have to press ‘next’ from previous field to get that field. Additionally it would have been great if the export facility for reports  was free of charge

title: Vastly Improved
body: I chose this title to represent both the app and my health. This app was crap in the early years, however after my wife became pre-diabetic and borderline obsessed with checking her BG, I decided to give it another go. I’ve gone from maybe checking x/day to at least 3. I’ve noticed a large improvement in my readings and overall health. Super easy to use.

title: I love this app
body: this app is wonderful! it’s extremely helpful when trying to log my numbers especially because normally writing them out is so tiring. plus it estimates your A1c which is helpful at working on getting it down or making sure it stays in good range. the layout of the app is also pleasing and super easy to use!

title: “Was” good. Now, not so much.
body: Not sure if there was a recent update, but this app used to be great. Lately, it has been really bad. Will no longer connect to my meter (yes, I tried everything). It has been really slow and lagging a ton. Now, it will drop my readings suddenly when I add them manually. Really seems like it is a mess right now. I have reversed my diabetes but like to track so I can finally convince my doctor it can be done. May have to try another app.

title: Great App!
body: This has made my tracking of my blood sugar so much easier and efficient.  Has a lot of additional features that would be helpful to those who have major issues with their BS levels.   I don’t use them but have looked around and these would be very helpful to others.  So glad I found this app.

title: Love this
body: I love being able to see my estimated A1C and seeing how it corresponds  to my actual one when I go in to the lab. Last time it said I was around 6.1-6.2 (hovering around there), and, when I went in to the lab, it was 6.1. Woo hoo! I also love being able to message my coach any time and knowing I would get a response from her. This app/program is awesome.

title: very convenient
body: I am actually acquiring a Guide Me to auto sync to the app as well as the bathroom scale which will record weight readings.  So I am definitely into the system.

title: Easy to use
body: This app has been so easy to use and nice to visually see my progress. I was diagnosed with gestational diabetes so hopefully only need to use for a short time.

title: One of the better...
body: This is one of the better diabetes tracking apps I've found. I've tried and paid for many.
response: Thank you for the positive review! Feedback is always welcome :)

title: Awesome love this app
body: I have been using this app for few days now and wow it's the best app out there. Let's you print out all the info even from Dexcom and your BG. This is well worth paying for your diabetes team will love the info and so will you. I plan on using this app from now on. Also give you estimate A1c which is a high plus for your goals. 5* from me. Thanks mySugr
response: Thanks so much for the positive review!! We love the A1C feature too :)

title: A God send!!!
body: I had been really in the dumps about my glucose levels when I ran across "mySugr."  It is super easy to use and the logbook makes it easy peezy to gage WHY I'm doing how I'm doing. It has made me more mindful and accountable. Numbers are looking MUCH better... And my 5 year old loves the sound of the monster giggling. The mySugr Team hit a home run with this one!!!! Thanks guys!!! Again, you ROCK.
response: You ROCK! Thanks for the great review!!

title: Recommend to anyone who is living with Diabetes
body: Love this App.  It lets me keep track of everything.  And when you join the monthly fee is worth it.  Not only do you get an unlimited supply of test strips but they also have coaches that will help you figure things out and offer support.  You can download reports that can help you notice trends.

title: Great for Data Collection Logs and Tracking
body: It provides lots of quick access for recording data from glucose level, diet, carbs, meals, time of day, ketones, weight, blood pressure and provides summaries (including predicted A1c) that can even be printed for a doctor. For children (and adults) there are “challenges” to keep you engaged, aware, and motivated to do detailed daily glucose testing.
response: Thanks for the review! :)

title: This is Amazing!
body: I found this amazing 🤩 app this morning for Diabetics and I have to say I like 👍🏽 it. If you have smart phone 📱 and a tester that’s 2017 or newer then you’ll love ❤️ this app. No more writing ✍🏽 down your levels cause when you check your sugar it goes right to your phone 📱 and it makes this cool 😎 sound letting you know it’s done ✅.

title: Great support
body: I would like to see the possibility to add a note next to a daily glucose reading. It could be a place to add medication changes, events that could contribute to higher readings, birthday party cake, etc (you got to live a little), travel(always stressful) , other events that might cause sugar spikes or sugar lows. Just an idea. Thx for being there for all of us out here.

title: Great App!!
body: MySugr is an amazing app for logging blood sugar. I love how it has a graph and gives you an estimated A1C. The monster is a cute feature and “taming” him gives motivation to log through the day. I do however, wish more of the features came without the premium. It’s a great package deal, but I don’t like that it has to come all together. I would like some more features on the app, but don’t need the whole package.

title: Nice app but Flawed
body: This is an easy to use app with a great layout and user friendly features. I would love to continue using this app, however there are fatal flaws with the connection to my Accu-Chek Guide meter. The app frequently loses wireless connection to where it’s no longer paired to the meter. We have to attempt to pair the device around 25+ times to reestablish connection. It does this frequently, sometimes on a daily basis. So frustrating for a potentially good app!!

title: Great app
body: App is a little more than I personally need but is good to keep track of many things health wise. I am a diabetic and it definitely helps me track my levels.

title: Easy for parents, my son loves the monster!
body: This app is so great for us to easily record what we need to! You can customize the fields to what you need, and I love the visual graph. My 5 year old loves the diabetes monster graphics. It makes this whole process a tiny bit easier on him, when he can watch the animated monster as we record his info.
response: Thanks so much for the positive review! We love hearing that mySugr can help kiddos living with diabetes too :)

title: The Charts are complicated
body: The functionality is good, but I would prefer a simpler looking chart. By putting all the information on one screen, the developers have made the charts too difficult to read. I would like to see an interactive charting feature.
response: Thank you so much for the positive review! We're always looking to improve and feedback is much appreciated :)

title: Great program
body: This has been a great program to track my Gestational Diabetes. Great to have on hand to record everything from snacks to insulin doses. I wish one think was clearer. I paid for the subscription so I could print out my reports to send to my doctor to help w/ prescribing insulin doses, but the pale colors on the report don’t fax well and isn’t a clear to read package for them. More color contrast would help.
response: Thanks so much for the feedback and the positive review! We always welcome suggestions and they will be passed on to our developers :)

title: Need narrative on suggested usage and better graphs of lt results.
body: Sorry, I put most of my comment in the title. I have been using the free program about 2 weeks and it’s taken me days to figure out how to fully use the app. I would love to see long term graphs as I need to see my improvements, if any over the next 3 months as I lose weight. Thanks.
response: Hello! Thank you so much for the positive review. We apologize for the issues you are running into. In regards to accessing reports you can log in at hello.mysugr.com and download PDF reports. If you have more specific questions please feel free to reach out to our support team at support@mysugr.com or visit our support tab on our website mysugr.com.

title: Pretty Cool
body: I downloaded this app after I heard a friend talk about it and then saw it mentioned in Diabetes Forecast magazine. I like that it shows an estimated hba1c because that keeps me motivated to bring it down! The only thing is: I wish there was a way to have friends on the app. I’m doing an hba1c challenge with diabetic coworkers and it’d be so neat if we could keep tabs on each other and cheer each other on.

title: Excellent for newbies to logging blood glucose!
body: I’m pre-diabetic and my doctor told me to start logging my blood sugars. I wanted an app that would work with me while I am on the go and the color coded G/Y/R readings make it easier for me to understand. I love the features where you can enter text/pictures of what you eat as a reminder and where you’re at too.
response: Thanks for the great review!

title: Disappointed
body: I wish there were more food categories/types to choose from. Different types of breakfast items, lunch items and dinner items would be great, this allows one to see exactly what foods effect the A1C. Types of fast foods would be helpful along with types of soft drinks. Ability to add multiple types of foods eaten throughout the day; such as fruits, vegetables, water, and etc. If someone eats multiple burgers, potatoes or sweets throughout the day makes a big difference in numbers. These all play a role in sugar levels.
response: Thank you for providing your valuable feedback. We're always working hard to improve the app. If you can not find a fitting food tag, a tip is to use the "notes" section. Please reach out to us at support@mysugr.com, we are always happy to help and to receive feedback and suggestions 💚

title: One place
body: It’s nice to have all my readings in one place.  It’s super convenient. My only issue is that it doesn’t always Bluetooth over. I don’t know if that is because of this app or my meter. So I manually input my numbers every once in a while. It’s still great to have all my numbers stored!! And there are more berks that I do not use yet.

title: From Drag to Blast
body: This has made food logging, sugar tracking and taking a genuine interest in my health stats FAR more fun and engaging!  Great interface for sharing reports with my doc and accountability group!!  Glad I found this app!  The challenges are great for us overachievers and ultra competitive!  It’s been a good when the monster has been tamed!  Love it!

title: Meter Reading on Blood
body: Since starting this process, I have definitely acknowledged the issue on the DIABETES aspect of health.  I started out on a HIGH note (225 or there about) and now I have come down considerably (110 or below to 85 with a few times higher depending on time and preferred appetite pleaser before bedtime).  There is an issue that I would prefer to get taken care of (device’s for taking sample of blood for testing).

title: Truly an excellent way to conveniently monitor my sugar levels
body: I I have been a diabetic foot quite some time using insulin three times a day now I have days when I only use the long-term insulant in the evening and with the help of an App called My Sugar and controlling my food intake it has made a miracles difference. Hopefully I feel I can stop my insulin injection in time.
response: Thanks so much for the positive review! We love hearing that mySugr is helping :)

title: Love this app!
body: This fun app has really helped me be better about testing and logging my food, carbs & testing results. There’s more options of things to log compared to other apps I’ve tried which I like because it gives me more information to help me stay on top of everything and get better glucose readings.
response: Hi! Thank you so much for the positive review and the great insight :) We are so happy to hear our app has been useful for you.

title: Simple interface
body: Simple interface with plenty of options to track details about food, carbs, activity, insulin, blood glucose, etc. Connects with my Accucheck Guide via bluetooth. I just use the free version and manually copy numbers to share with my doctor. Only need the pay version if you want to download a report.

title: Excellent Tracker
body: My sugar has made tracking my sugar easier and has helped me track more testing. Would be awesome if you could scan food barcodes to help with a quicker way of carb counting and then people could share how they react with the same food and could help others and work together fitness apps, like “My fitness Pal”

title: Best thing yet
body: Best app for a diabetic, no matter how long you’ve been one. I’ve tried many “logs” and this is the only one I’ve stuck with. My children enjoy listening to my monster and encourage me to check my sugar more often. They understand the difference in hyper and hypo sugars now. It’s a learning tool for them and a living tool for me!!!

title: Great App
body: I was told my glucose numbers put me in the prediabetic range last year.   My nutritionist recommended I try mySugr to monitor my numbers and better understand and control my A1C.    MySugr is easy to use, very reliable and syncs well with my other health apps.    I have my A1C in the normal range now, as it was easy to see patterns and reasons for elevated numbers.    I recommend mySugar.

title: Birdmanaz
body: Would of gave it more but the feature that gives an estimate of your A1c after so many days of checking your blood sugar 3 times a day finally completes the circle, it tells you it’s a pro feature you have to pay for! It should be grayed out or let you know from the beginning it’s a pro feature that’s only on the paid upgrade.
response: Hello! Thank you so much for the positive review. One the free version the estimated A1C should be available after making three entries a day for one week. If this is not showing up or working for you please feel free to reach out to our support team at support@mysugr.com and we can figure out what the problem is.

title: Controlling my diabetes
body: This app has helped me get my diabetes under control.  The monster makes the app fun to use, too.  I started by just tracking my blood sugar, but it really started making a difference for me when I started tracking my carbs, too.

title: Best blood glucose log app out there!
body: I have been using this app for over two years now.  I am type 1 and I currently use injections instead of the pump.  This app has helped me keep on track and correct my sometimes faulty memory of what I ate of how much I dosed of insulin previously.  I also like the trending and report data.

title: Great Features, Almost Completely Unusable
body: First: I like the feature set of this app, so much so that I subscribed. However, the app is almost completely unusable. Any attempt to sync with HealthKit will cause the app to become unresponsive for many minutes at a time, as you watch helplessly while the screen slowly redraws over and over and over again.
response: Hi Jess! Thank you for your feedback! We are so sorry to hear you are running into these issues. Please reach out to our support team at support@mysugr.com and we will be more than happy to get you up and running with our app. Thank you for your initial interest and we hope you will stick around.

title: I’ve tried others, but this app is the best.
body: This app offers for me is the best. It offers more inside of each blood test that helps with figuring out how many carbs work with a host of other variables, like fasting, total exercise hours and minutes. And then you can also put in notes. This app helps me with my controlling my sugar.
response: We're so glad to hear that mySugr is helping and greatly appreciate your positive review!

title: Amazing!!
body: I have been using this app off and on for over a year! I had to stop using it when my old phone didn’t have enough storage space to use it. But I love being able to show it to my provider and we can both see how I was feeling and what was going on! I highly recommend it!
response: Sometimes we forget as diabetics that stress affects our blood sugars, but the app makes it easier to consider these things when logging :) Thank you for the positive review and we're so happy to hear that the app is helping!!

title: Works well for me
body: As a new type 2, I was looking for a simple app to track 1x daily readings.  My Sugr fits the bill perfectly. I upgraded to be able to get reports which are produced as pdf files which I can print off or email to my doctor.  He’s impressed, and has suggested it to many of his patients.
response: Hi! Thank you so much for the positive review. We are so glad to hear our app has been helpful for you! We are happy to hear about the recommendations also, glad your doctor is happy with our app as well.

title: Track
body: What I like about this app is the ease of tracking my finger stick results. I haven’t started to use the other features yet to take advantage of this app’s full potential, which is amazingly comprehensive. It is a bit too cutesy for my taste, but that, of course, doesn’t impact its functionality. Excellent app!! Thank you.

title: Even The Free Version Is Great
body: I don’t subscribe to the services offered. I use only the free version modules. However, simply having the little monster celebrate when my levels are good does lift my spirits and make me want to work harder and eat better. The app has never crashed on me and it adds the data to the Health app seamlessly. I love it!

title: Perfect for Accu-Check user
body: This is exactly what I wanted for tracking my blood glucose level and food every day for gestational diabetes. It automatically syncs with my Accu-Check Guide, and allows me to add photos of meals and notes easily. The user interface is awesome. Using for two days and already feel like I can’t live without this app!

title: Love this App!
body: I found this app by accident and have thoroughly enjoyed it. There are 2 options I wish it included:

title: Amazing apps for data nerds with T1D
body: I’m a data scientist recently diagnosed with T1D as an adult. This app is a dream for understanding how my blood glucose responds to food, activity, and other things. There are a couple more modalities that I’d add myself, but the creators should be proud of how this tool assist those trying to understand their health. Really looking forward to what else they might add to this app!

title: The ABSOLUTE Best!!!
body: I’ve tried several and I mean several other apps.  Even ones that have glucose monitors that are suppose to sync my readings and none of them work like this one. I’ve tried to leave only because I thought that I’d found something better then I realize that it was just not worth it!

title: My Sugar Buddy Keeps Me In Control!
body: My (previous) Endocrinologist demanded that I keep my sugar numbers on paper and it wasn’t working for me. I found Sugar Buddy and started by keeping track of my carbs with the free version and eventually upgraded to the Pro version. I log everything and I’m taking charge of my sugars better now than ever before. I Love My Sugar Buddy!
response: Electronic logging is the way to go! Thanks for the great review!

title: Great for just measuring Glucose
body: Those with Type 1 diabetes and are children, this is a great tool! Highly suggest. I have tried them all and I am currently still using this one. Horrible tool to use for those of us with weight struggles. Although it gives you the ability to log your weight, you have zero documentation of your logs in the reports section. Still having to use another application to measure and track my weight loss.
response: Thank you so much for the feedback. We're always looking to improve and your suggestion will be passed on to our developers :)

title: Diabetes educator and doctors were impressed with reports
body: Easy to use, laid out well. Good reports. Future feature directions would be to integrate with a carb counting or nutritional app that has up-to-date carb counts from chain name restaurants, fast food, and brand name packaged foods. Short of that, more reporting options and annotation for changing meters would be helpful.
response: Hi! Thank you so much for the positive review. We are so glad to hear you are happy with our app! We really appreciate your ideas too! We will definitely keep them in mind as we are constantly working on improving our app and making it the best it can be.

title: My Sugar
body: A fun way of checking my sugar, looking at the color coded stats and checking off before a meal or not helps me determine when my sugar has taken a turn. I still don’t understand everything, but learning. User friendly and fun to use once set up. Would like to upgrade maybe later.
response: Hi! Thank you so much for the positive review. We are so glad to hear our app has been so helpful for you. Having Pro is great because you can download your reports right in the app and there are also lots of extra tags to categorize your entries! Let us know if you have any more questions before making the switch :)

title: Amazing App for Newbies
body: I’m 8 months pregnant and have been diagnosed with gestational diabetes. I haven’t been perfect with recording meals and blood sugar levels, but I know I wouldn’t have done nearly as well without this app! Being able to import my levels straight from my monitor and keep my meal times and contents in one place has been awesome.

title: So far so great
body: This app has really helped me to keep better track of my glucose levels. By logging my meds, meals and their carbs, and seeing the direct effects of my meal choices, I have become more conscious and better at keeping my numbers in check. No complaints at all, just a request: Dark Mode, please?
response: Hello! Thank you so much for your review - we'd love to help you! Can you write to us at support@mysugr.com and we'll get right on it for you!

title: Awesome
body: Most like the original log book we were shown to use. No other apps have all the info we need stored and so easy to use. Great that both my wife and I can have access to the same information at the same time.

title: Love this app
body: I’m new to having to check my blood sugar each morning. This app has been a great way to keep track each morning. I love the sounds. I’ve only met one challenge because as I stated above, I only check my blood sugar each morning. I think it would be nice to have challenges for people like me.

title: Just wonderful!
body: This app has been extremely helpful in logging my food, meds, and glucose levels. I am not one to write down everything in a log but being able to add the little things (ie. weight, carbs, etc) has really opened my eyes to the changes that occur depending on what I eat. Thank you!

title: On track
body: I’m new to monitoring on a daily basis. Type 2, but other diet plans weren’t working. Decided to monitor glucose, because that won’t lie! It has changed the way I eat. The scale is going down daily as I keep blood sugars normal. Great app...wish it had food lists like Noom to help count carbs and nutrition. I’m currently using both apps and it’s a pain.

title: All that I was looking for in 1 app
body: I downloaded three other apps bc I couldn’t find one with everything that I was looking for until I discovered reading about my Accu-Check GuideMe that I could connect it to my iPhone by downloading this app, and wow!!! Very impressed in how much information I’m getting out of it. Love it!!!

title: Easy to use
body: I have struggled with keeping my A1c down and being able to see the results of my monitoring certainly helps. I am now able to see some patterns of where I need to make adjustments. Being able to export the data makes it simple to share with my physician. Thank you!!
response: Thanks for the positive review!! We love the A1C feature on the app too :)

title: My sugar
body: Very good program for keeping track of my sugar but a little labor intensive.  I am sure once I get used to it it will become faster.  Sometimes I cannot find a copy of a report...because we do not get that without paying for the pro version.
response: Thanks for the positive review and feedback! There are a lot of options for tracking in the app, just remember you can use as many or as few works for you. The Pro version is just $2.99 a month...less than a cup of coffee :)

title: Love it
body: Love this app , it’s easy and lots to show on it. I would love more data, that can allow me to see trends over days, weeks or months . I would also like to see the buttons I pick such as breakfast, feeling sick , hard workout etc to be labeled next to my sugars and insulin to get a better understanding.

title: Detail or Not to Detail
body: I like this app. Lots of areas to store as much or little info as you want. Nice adjustable parameters help achieving your goals at a glance. Don’t feel like entering your info? Just tap on some icons to quickly enter your basic deets. I don’t have a new enough meter to hook into the app but I would like to. Maybe drop the price of the add-one once you have enough subscribers?

title: Best app I’ve used for diabetes control
body: I have used three or four different apps and this one is by far my favorite. I love that you can see your A1C and I love that is so user-friendly with a beautiful interface. My kids love watching me enter my numbers because they like watching the little sugar monster. :)

title: Guide Me - Help Needed
body: Overall, the app is impressive with elements of sensory overload.  A video demonstrating use would be very helpful.  At present, I feel that I am attempting to make the best use of the app - in the dark.  I would not hesitate to recommend the app, with the caveat of “spend the time necessary to get the most data support from the app”.

title: Love this app!
body: I’ve had diabetes since 2001 and have NEVER had an A1c lower than 9!  With this app helping me track EVERYTHING, I’m on my way to my first A1c under 7!  Oooh-we, I just love it!!!  I also not only remember  but look forward to checking my sugars and entering my info because I love monsters noises when I enter information 🥰

title: Easy to navigate
body: As a new type 2 diabetic, I was looking for a user friendly app that I could enter information into to share with my dr. This has been perfect for me! I’m learning about new features every day. I did go ahead and upgrade to the purchased version, so I can enter even more info.

title: Fun and easy!
body: I dreaded recording and counting every carb and food item but this app makes it fun and easy. Love the Bluetooth auto record from my Accucheck monitor and the downloadable reports I can quickly share w my dr and nutritionist. If there is a more user friendly app out there for blood sugar tracking I haven’t found it!

title: Very helpful tracker
body: Bought on a whim because I was purchasing an Apple Watch and I wanted to pair steps and mySugr between phone and watch and while that hasn’t happened yet, the app has been very helpful in negotiating the day.  Have been fighting this disease for 50 years now so actively seeing the aic projection is very helpful in my fight!

title: Really easy to use!
body: This app has been super helpful in logging my daughter’s numbers for her Type 1 diabetes. I like how I can customize the fields I use and the notes section is great for any extra info I need to add. Her endocrinologist even can log in and check on her if I have any questions about how she’s doing.
response: Thank you so much for the positive review :) We are so happy to hear our app has been useful for you and your daughter! Thank you for sharing.

title: Seems to track well and has the right fields
body: I have been trying this app for around a week or so and it seems to have all the fields needed to track my food etc. the paid version has an option to run resets as well which I haven’t subscribed to, yet.

title: Game changer
body: This app has been amazing in the past week that I have used it. I upgraded to pro immediately and I’m so happy I did. Please please don’t change this app. I’ve used a few others over the years that have been deleted and it’s a bummer. My Sugr is so far the best I’ve found. Thank you

title: I’m loving this app!!!
body: I’ve been a type 1 diabetic for over 50 years.  I’m in excellent control, but have suffered some of the long-term side effects over the years.  I love this app, especially the A1c estimator.  I’ve learned that the more information I input, the more reliable that number is.   It really keeps me motivated!  :)

title: Easy to use and has all the fields I need
body: It connects to my blood glucose monitor smoothly, and automatically transfers the readings, and has fields for several other readings, like weight, blood pressure, and diet. It also generates informative reports and calculates my probable a1c, and does it all with an easy to use interface. Top notch logging app.

title: Awesome app! Newly Type 1 and this is really helping me!
body: Awesome app! I hope you guys integrate this into the Apple Watch—- I’m 41and have adult onset Type 1 Diabetes’s-, this app is making it a lot easier for me to keep track of my sugars-
response: Thank you so much for the great review! We appreciate the feedback and I will pass it on to our developers as we're always looking to improve. A Youtube tutorial sounds like a great idea!

title: Easiest One Yet
body: So far of al the apps that’s out there this one us the best and the easiest one to follow. Everything that you need is right on your fingertips. All you have to do is click what you have done and off you go. Thanks for this app I am able to follow my blood sugar everyday and see where I stand.
response: That's great to hear!! We love our easy interface too! Thanks for the positive review :)

title: Great app
body: The app is a fun way to track your blood glucose levels. It’s interactive and rewards make it a fun goal to always keep levels in the green. I like that you can log what you’ve eaten so you can see what raises or lowers your levels. This app has helped me lower my numbers to almost a non diabetic. Almost there!
response: You are doing great!! Keep up the good work!

title: Lifesaving!
body: Amazing app that should be recommended to any diabetic or pre-diabetic! Haven’t tried the premium features yet but what you get for free is so helpful. My only complaint is that I wish they offered a separate package where you could talk to a diabetic counselor, without needing the bundle. I would love to have that option!!
response: Hi! Thank you so much for the positive review :) We are glad you are enjoying the free version of our app and it sounds like you might be interested in the mySugr Bundle as well! In addition to offering unlimited test strips and printable PDF reports, the bundle also offers unlimited access to a Certified Diabetes Health Coach at the push of a button to help in between doctors visits! You can get access to all of this for $39/month. Please let us know if you have more questions or are interested in getting started with the bundle! We are available here or through our support line at support@mysugr.com.

title: Love this app
body: I love that it keeps track of my BG numbers and I can print out reports or send them to my Doctor.  I love that it automatically sends you strips according to the actual amount you use.  I love that I don’t have to write down my numbers i just hit send and it logs for me.  I love the graphs they are easy to read.

title: Easy to use and practical app
body: I am new to tracking blood glucose numbers and keeping a log - this makes it pretty easy for a beginner too...
response: Hi Vidhi P, thanks so much for the positive review. We know, MyFitnessPal is a great app for tracking your meals, exercise, and weight. Whether you're a newbie and only track calories and carbs, or if you are hard-core and track macros, MyFitnessPal seems like a great solution for helping you get on track and stay motivated in your awesome efforts.

title: Easy Simple
body: I am a recently diagnosed type 2 diabetic. My mom came upon MySugr and we read about it together. It looked so easy to use and it has proven to be just that. I’m able to track my blood sugar daily, as well as my carbs and calories. Thanks for making this new medical issue so very easy to deal with.
response: We're so happy to hear that the app is making things a little easier :) Thank's for the positive review!!

title: Easy To Use App
body: I’ve been using this app for several years. It’s a great app and easy to use. I like that I can easily go back and see previous readings without a bunch of clutter or hassle. I wish I could connect my fitness tracker/app to track my steps instead of having to manually enter them.
response: Thank you so much for the positive review and feedback!! We're working on more connections all the time and Myfitnesspal or something similar should be available soon :)

title: Easy and fun to look at!
body: Thank you mySugr,
response: Hi! Thank you so much for the positive review. We are so happy to hear that our app has been so useful (and fun!) for you and your husband. Keep up the great work and we've got your back.

title: App
body: I am just using the app. It is what my doctor recommended. I need everything except the coach and strips. I wish I could afford the pro version but I get free daily calls and strips are free. It would be great for me to get the picture and not the above mentioned features. App is great other than I can’t afford the meds, dr and app

title: Type 1 Teen
body: My son was diagnosed with Type 1 in June at 13. This app has helped us stay organized and on top of all the new habits we need to create. He’s about to get his first constant CGM and it stinks that this doesn’t immediately sync but I will continue to use the app for all the other great features it offers.

title: Next to worthless
body: Maybe a good medical recording app for kids, but it is definitely NOT a  diabetes tracking tool for the grown-up.  Too much cutsie and not enough control.
response: Sorry to hear that you did not like our mySugr app. We are always happy for feedback and interested to hear how we can improve our app 🙂A few of your suggestions are already possible. Please contact us at support@mysugr.com. We will be more than happy to answer any questions you might have 💚

title: Review
body: This app has been very beneficial to me in the short time I’ve been using it it really keeps me accountable and gives me pretty good feedback on what I’ve eaten and it’s impact on my blood sugar levels. Very functional very useful very user-friendly and I am very highly satisfied with the product so far.

title: Keeping track
body: I am having fun with this app, because I can see how my diet affects my sugar. I am continuing to have fun with My Sugar App, I am using it with Lose It App and in Health App. I have the Freestyle Libre it allows me to have a better handle my readings. My Sugar allows me to keep better track of my meds. My Doctor likes it too.
response: Hi! Thank you so much for the positive review! We are so glad our app has been helpful for you :)

title: No longer works on iPhone 6
body: I wanted to start using this app again, but when I redownloaded it I was only able to get the “latest compatible version,” which was then “unable to connect to the mySugr server” so I could not log in and use it. I know one of the previous versions should work fine with my phone because I’ve used it in the past (and the issue now is not related to my internet connection- it’s the app itself).
response: Hi Nate! Thank you so much for your feedback! Do you happen to have iOS version 13.0 or later. If you have iOS 13.0 or later please let us know in support, we'd love to help you get the app up and running again on your device! support@mysugr.com

title: Complaint
body: Why can’t I update this ap? Every time try to log information it says there is a critical update needed and then I get sent to this review screen. Even after rating the ap it doesn’t update. I just want to use it, not write a million reviews. The more towns this goes wrong the less likely I am to continue use of this particular ap.
response: Thank you for your concern!! We’re sorry you’re having trouble with updates!

title: The best diabetic app
body: I’ve used this app on & off for a handful of years, it wasn’t until I purchased the bundle that I started using it as my primary log. The app is simple & straight to the point, offers a lot of options for blood sugar entries, you set it up the way it works for you. Feels very polished too

title: Awesome Resource
body: This is a great app to help stay on top of things especially if you use all the tools loaded in this app. I get to see a comprehensive picture of how I’m doing throughout the day and weeks therefore, I can get ahead of things and find out what is working and what is not working

title: Tracking made easy
body: Blood sugars are loaded automatically.  Listing all the additional info gives a great overview of what may be causing higher blood sugars.  By the same token what makes a lower blood.  I have only been using for a couple of weeks but am very pleased with what I am learning.

title: Love this app!!!
body: mySugr has become a wonderful, central tool in managing my diabetes.  I’ve tried a number of different apps.  MySugr by far has the most customizable and easy to use data entry UI of all of them. The export makes it easy to pull the data into Excel for analysis.  Can’t wait to see my next a1c! 😃

title: Awesome app
body: I love how easy it is to use and track my sugar.  It’s so nice having a way to digitally track my sugar no matter where I am at and have my sugar history on hand.  I can see trends and I love the pictures icon I can click to represent my activities, feelings, etc...  I wish it would sync with my prodigy meter.

title: Very effective way to track blood sugar levels
body: This has been a very helpful way to follow my blood sugar levels and patterns. I like the ability to download 2 weeks worth of data to look at on the whole. Then I can email the form to my HCP.

title: It’s good
body: I’ve just been diagnosed with type 2 diabetes. I’ve been using this app for about three weeks now.  My doctor wants me to track my carbs, sugar and protein. It would be nice for the app to have options of what to track. Right now I have to make notes on how much sugar and protein I had. It does have a place for carbs though. Other than that it’s a great app.

title: Convenient and easy to use
body: After a diagnosis of gestational diabetes I was asked to fill out a paper log of my blood sugars 4 times a day. I investigated and found this app where I can log and then export the data to send to my provider. This has worked great and only complaint is the export always shows 4 weeks so comes out small.

title: Great app!
body: Great app to keep my sugar readings. Only thing is I cannot pair and old meter( AccuChek guide meter because for some reason it doesn’t allow me to pair it again. I have to record my readings manually instead of the reading going directly into the app. Otherwise I have little to complain about.
response: Hi! Thank you so much for the positive review. We are sorry to hear about the connection issues you are having. Please reach out to our support team at support@mysugr.com and we will be more than happy to help you get to the bottom of it.

title: Great app!
body: I started using this app a few months ago and I appreciate it. I like that it shows an estimated a1c so you know what to expect when going into the endo. I wish it left more fields to input exactly what you ate besides a little description box. And I wish it had an Apple Watch app, allowing me to input levels from my watch rather than my phone.
response: Hi Bbecca thanks so much for the great review! Here is a little info on how to connect to your Apple health...

title: Great App
body: App is running great and helping me with my diabetes management. Enjoy the projected A1c value and the daily point value.  I just really don't get/like monster face symbol.  Wish the monster face was different of my of a character.  Also would like more of an ability to edit and create my own activities.
response: Thank you for the positive review and feedback! The idea for more available activities is great and will be passed on :)

body: I've been using this app for well over two years now - including the stopping of my messy paper journal after well over 20 years. I’ve been printing  out reports for my doc in PDF format and he has been pleased. A1c’s have been consistently good!!  Thanks for an excellent tool -- much appreciated...
response: The estimated A1C is one of our favorite features too :) Thanks for the great review!!

title: Helps me manage my diabetes
body: I don’t use any carb entries in this app (I have another), but everything else works fine. Like the reminder function. My doctor was impressed with the reports. I like the deviation listing and the averages from the main screen are helpful.
response: Hi! Thak you so much for the positive review :) We are glad to hear you would buy our app again!

title: Great app
body: I started using this during a period of time where I was transitioning between doctors and I started slacking on taking care of myself. I’ve never consistently tested my blood sugar more frequently and have good numbers than when I use this app! I highly recommend for anyone (I’m type 1).
response: Hi! Thank you so much for the positive review. We are so glad to hear our app has been so helpful for you and encouraged you to test more. Thank you for the recommendations as well!

title: Excellent Aid!
body: This is a fantastic aid to my blood sugar Control!
response: Thanks so much for the great review!

title: Keeps Me On Track!
body: This APP is great for new diagnoses.  It keeps you on track and the options available when editing (snack, exercise, shopping, driving etc) remind you of things you must stay on top of on a daily basis.  This has been hard but thank you so much!

title: I’ve used this app forever...
body: I used MySugr for ages. Originally, it helped me to control my diabetes so well, I was off all meds. Unfortunately, I got complacent and had some other health problems that threw me off my game. I’m working to get back on track and I fully expect that my experience will be as positive as it has been in the past. Thanks for this.

title: Awesome
body: I really get to monitor my sugar I know when it’s very high I know when it’s medium and I know when it’s low color coordinate coordination makes it easier to understand. And now I’m also starting to learn how to put the medication and how to put my meals in there too I like that very very much

title: HONESTY
body: Honesty would demand that you acknowledge that one cannot access your app until AFTER you collect information from them, and after they pay a subscription fee to you. It’s truly deceptive that you Intentionally neglect to list on the download page that this fee IS REQUIRED prior to use of your app. And concealing it as an “in app purchase” is pretty grimy. For the record, if you have to pay a “subscription fee” before being given access to the app, it is NOT an “IN” app purchase. It is a fee to use the app.

title: Managing Blood Sugars
body: This app has tremendously help me because it avoids paper tracking sheet, I take this app with me to my Endocrinologist! I have a constant reminder to test three to four times a day! It give the ability to see how blood sugars are running and if there needs to be an adjustment to my diabetic medications!
response: Hi! Thank you so much for the positive review. We are so glad to hear our app has been so helpful for you. Keep up the good work and we've got you back!

title: Helping Control Diabetes
body: My Sugr is great!  Fun and easy to use. I have been more diligent in recording my blood glucose levels and it’s paying off.  I now can see what foods trigger highs and it helps me to respond quicker to lows.  Funny little monster sounds it makes would make this the perfect tool for young diabetics.

title: MySugr helped me regulate my diabetes better than my meds
body: MySugr has become a daily part of my life, and it is the best way for me to track my blood sugar, meals, workouts, medicines and overall health. It also allows me to print out a report that I can share with my doctor. I highly recommend it!

title: Great app
body: I was recently diagnosed with diabetes and this app is a great way to keep track of my blood sugar. I also appreciate it syncing to Apple Health showing my workouts along with my sugar readings.

title: Easy to use!
body: I love the ease of use to record my activities and numbers.  The ability to export the reports so I can give them to my doctor really simplifies things too. I always have my phone but not my logbook. This is a great app that is a valuable tool in treating/tracking my diabetes.

title: Helpful
body: Honestly, this has been a wonderful app. It helps me see when I’ve been getting certain highs throughout the day, and then track it and give more/ less insulin, or change a basal rate, etc. it has fun features and challenges too. Thank you for the app.

title: Thank you for being here!
body: Thank you for making it fun and easy to be accountable for my health.

title: Accuracy
body: When I started using My Sugar, my A1C was 7.3. When it was time for my next A1C, My Sugar estimated my A1C as 5.7. When my A1C came back, it was 5.7! You can’t get any more accurate than that. My Sugar estimate is now 5.4. I have stopped taking metformin, and I am looking forward to my next A1C test in two weeks.

title: Good for me
body: Since my diagnosis last year, this has been the app used to record and transport my readings to my doctors. It’s easy to use and the app allows putting notes in to explain highs/lows. For now, the paid version is too expensive for our budget, but the free version is great.

title: Helping me getting handle on my blood sugar
body: As I have used this app for the last few weeks,

title: Essential Diabetes management app
body: I’ve been using this app for years now and it’s continuing to improve. As a diabetic, I appreciate everything this app has to offer.

title: Cheering squad
body: I love how the little icon gets excited when my sugar levels go down and moans when my levels get higher! Something this simple seems to inspire me, as it feels as if I have a cheering squad. I haven’t tried all the other elements in the app, as I’m still a newcomer, but I like it thus far!
response: Thanks for the great review! We love the monster cheer squad too!

title: Decent service until you want to cancel
body: Strips arrive as needed - app works fine, but if you want to cancel, it’s HORRIBLE.  I’ve been trying for 2 months to cancel. My only hope is to protest the credit card charges at this point. You can’t access your card info. You can’t talk to a human. The coaches don’t respond. All of my 17 emails apparently went to spam. The only way I successfully contacted them was with support form on website. That results in an e-mail from them but my many replies are ignored. Beware!
response: We are very sorry to hear that you're having problems reaching us! Please contact us at support@mysugr.com. We would love to help you 💚

title: Tracking how food impacts my sugar
body: This has been so helpful!  A notebook didn’t work for me... but my phone is generally with me or near... and the app - with its daily average and color coding has really helped me learn about the foods I must avoid-  finally on track for getting my A1c in an acceptable range.  Thanks!

title: Great Help
body: I got this originally cause I like data and this app seemed to supply that. At first I kind discounted the idea of a “coach”. I have found out that the key to this app IS the coach. I did not expect to be creating a relationship that would help me control my diabetes SO well. Indispensable!  Don’t blow off the idea of using the coach!!!

title: Fair
body: Good app just using it for tracking as the full app does not work well for my type 2 diabetes. My doctor only has me checking my blood first thing in the morning only. So not sure I will keep using it. It would be better if modified for type 2.

title: Easy app for tracking
body: This app is very easy to setup and use. Just using the free version for now but it does what I need it to do..

title: Just perfect for me
body: I'm not usually the best when it comes to taking care of my diabetes because I'm not organized so this app has not only helped me with a great way to keep a history of my blood sugar a1c it has also helped me to feel more motivated to take care of myself

title: Fun and easy to use!
body: This app makes it easy to track your glucose levels so you can document your readings to see if you are keeping within your target range. The interactive icon cheers you on or warns you if you need to make adjustments in your sugar intake.
response: Thanks for the great review!!

title: Love
body: I live this app it’s helped me to keep better track of my highs and lows. Great app but it keeps asking me to submit  a review so I’ll just keep adding to this review I posted yesterday twice and now once today!

title: Accountability
body: Diabetes is about being accountable to yourself. This app makes it very easy to help reverse your diabetes by tracking everything! It is intuitive and simple to use. I’ve tried many “Diabetes Apps” and this one is light years ahead of any others. Download it now!
response: Thank you very much for the positive review! We love how simple the app is to use too :)

title: Newbie - but liking mySugr!
body: I was using One Drop, but needing to buy THEIR test strips and use THEIR lancet and meter - meter was never accurate; lancet was very painful; test strips were expensive.  Plus they have this totally ridiculous carrying case that was - well - useless!  MySugr coordinates with my AccuChek meter, and that makes it soooo easy!  Now, I just have to get my Endo on board - he likes the handwritten journals! ☹️
response: Thanks so much for the great review!! Try showing your doctor the PDF reports that the app can generate and he may change his tune :)

title: Like tracking electronically
body: Nice not to have to hunt for paper type books to track glucose. Doctor likes to to be able to see.  Most diabetics don’t have to take their glucose 3 times a day unless sugars are really out of wack.  Can you not show a weekly average on just once a day?
response: Thank you for the awesome review!! To get an estimated A1C you would have to test 3 times a day for 7 days. We may be able to change this in the future as we're always making improvements :)

title: Expanded functions
body: It would be handy if this app had an entry for counting calories and monitoring weight loss.  Keeping track of other diet related things such as salt and saturated fats would be nice too.  Having a search function where the software would search for the food items on the internet, gather the related nutritional data, and input the data into your file would be nice.
response: Thank you for the positive review and feedback!! We love hearing from our users on what they would add or change. The idea for nutrition tracking is awesome and will be passed on to our developers :)

title: AMAZING
body: Okay so full on honestly, whether you use the free version or paid, this app tracks your blood sugars and it’s great! So easy and I enjoy taming my monster😂! Let it be known that I use it for type one even though I have a meter/remote that connects to my pump. I love it sooo much because it’s sooo easy and sooo helpful! Thank you!!!!
response: Thank you so much for the positive review :) We really appreciate you sharing your great experience with our app with us! Happy monster taming!

title: Great app, however
body: Great app. I like all the features but the price for premium is way, way to high. If I want to send a report to my health care team it should either be free, because it matters in terms of my diabetes management, or make it $40 or less.
