Some of those are a bit random and there are other more obvious ones that could be included. Overall, I love this app and the mySugr Suite. Thank you for having a different outlook on this disease. It’s not a death sentence and therefore we can have fun with it.

title: Not bad... Getting better!
body: I have been using this app for a few years and I'm a premium user. It's pretty great but I wish it would sync better with other apps. If I enter my glucose in another it doesn't end up on here but if I enter it here, the other app always picks it up. I also really need an Apple Watch app/complication. I'm having to use diabetes kit also because it shows an estimate of insulin on board and your last check. Pretty awesome. If this app had that it would be hands down the best app available. I really wish there was an Apple Watch but I still can't let this app go because it's been there for a long time and is pretty good.

title: Worth the yearly sub!
body: I've used a few different diabetes apps, some far better than others. Those don't hold half a burned out candle to this one. I've had horrible control over my diabetes through the years, and none of the apps have engaged me enough, or motivated me to keep up with it. I know for some this might not help you keep up with the logs but somehow this app has what I need. The challenges certainly help engage me, and I'm motivated to keep up with it since I put up money for it. But the added features I pay for are worth it as well, I can email my doctor my logs easily and they can get back to me on a regular basis. This has helped me curb my high blood sugar levels.

title: A second review
body: My initial review was around a year maybe 2 years ago and at that time it had great potential, but didn't meet the needs of this type of app..

title: A
body: A+

title: Must-Have
body: Just wanted to say how much I have been enjoying your app! Logging has always been the part of my care that I couldn't stand. This app has made it fun and gives me an actual motivation to log my sugars regularly! As I recently made the switch from pumping to injections, the user-friendly design and charting has allowed us to see trends in my sugar and adjust accordingly. Plus, I love the challenges and they help me stay motivation and strive for an even better level of self care. And who wouldn't love the 'scary' diabetes monster- my toddler loves him, and likes to help me input my sugars and see what the monster does! It's been a great tool to introduce him to diabetes and he thinks mommy's medicine time is fun!! Thank you for such a creative, user-friendly, and fun app. Definitely makes my daily care a lot more enjoyable!!

title: Best app ever!
body: I have tried various diabetes related apps, but this is the first one I haven't deleted, and which I really enjoy using! I'm a type 1 diabetic on multiple daily injections and this app is such a great way for me to track trends and have some fun while trying to control this crazy and unpredictable disease. Yes I said fun! The little interactive diabetes monster always makes me laugh or smile, if my blood sugar results aren't up to standards. The challenges provided are also a really fun and helpful tool!

title: New to App
body: I recently started using the app. It's only 2.5 weeks and so far I like it . It is easy to use and informative! I like having an easy and fun way to track my BGL's. I wouldn't  track on paper and I find I'm more committed to tracking now because of the app. I like the visuals and the graphs .. Of course "ramming the monster" lol. The only thing I would like added at this point would be to divide the sections into before meals and after meals and snacks.. Just for more clarity and for those of us who need to test more often. I never printed out a report yet.. Looking forward to that for the insurance company and Doctors office as well. I'll save that for my next review. I have the new iPhone 6 plus and have not had any crashes, or bugs as of today. I recommend this app for anyone who is looking to learn how to control their diabetes and track BGL.

title: Great App
body: This is by far the easiest (and best to look at) app I've used for my Diabetes. I would give 5 Stars, but I have like two pet peeves with this app.

title: Life changing technology
body: I have had type 1 diabetes for 34 years. I have always struggled with record keeping and with controlling my diabetes monster. This tool is so easy to use and is clearly designed by people who GET IT. I have used all the diabetes apps and this one is the only one that has worked well enough to keep using. It's about time that we had this technology and the attitude and mindset behind its design. Since I started using MySugr and consistently and honestly tracking all of the factors involved in managing the monster my HbA1C is lower than it has ever been and I feel better and more positive about my ability to control that number and I am able to be realistic about the data without beating myself up about specific numbers. To all the My Sugr staff, you rock! You are changing the world! Thank you!

title: Life Changing App
body: This app has been life changing for me and my quest to better control my type 1 diabetes. First off it has a really nice, easy to use interface that's attractive on my iPhone 6 plus and also pleasing to the eye. It's very easy to input and keep track of important data, and the points scale makes it fun and rewarding even for this guy in his 30s to keep tabs on his blood sugars and diet. I have even started counting my own carbs and using them to better control my numbers daily! The feedback from this group has been great and they are very involved in emails and on social media. If you need help or have a question just ask and they get back to you in great time! Thanks for the support and I hope to continue making strides in my health with the use of this great app!

title: Good app. Kind of fun.
body: Let's face it. There's nothing "fun" about diabetes or about stabbing yourself multiple times per day. However this app is "kinda" fun! I'm only using the free version.  It provides enough of what I need.  But if I stick with it then eventually I'll probably upgrade to the paid version.  Another reviewer posted that it's $20 per month.  That is incorrect.  I'm pretty sure it's $2.99/month or a yearly subscription for less than $30. I think it's $27 or $28.  Getting the paid version opens up more challenges, which might motivate me to do more good things like .... exercise.  Upgraded version also offers more export options for the info you're tracking. But for now the export offered with the free version works for me.  It's not real clean but it works. I applaud he developers for trying to make this fun.

title: T1_40years and counting!
body: I NEVER write reviews however, this app is so fantastic, I feel compelled to contribute to my Sugr's beer/Diet Coke bank!

title: Literally a Life Saver
body: ** UPDATE May 2017- my A1c is now 8.1--*UPDATE April 2016**. Just got my A1C results- I went from an 11.8 down to a 9.1 in 3 months. I owe it to this app******Diagnosed in 2000 with type 2 diabetes.  I didn't take it seriously until I was put on insulin 2 years ago.  Now I am on 3 insulin medicines and have muscle loss and eye issues and my A1c was at 12.6.  I wasn't taking my medicine correctly mainly because I couldn't SEE the affects.  With the MYSUGR app I can set up reminders on a busy day, I can see how much the insulin is working and how certain foods make my sugars rise.  I will be getting my A1c done by the lab and it will be interesting to see if it is close to my estimated A1c on the app.  This has also made me aware of how many carbs I have been taking in.  I pay monthly and it is such a small price for what I'm gaining in health benefits and knowledge!

title: Finally the perfect BS AND BP app!
body: My blood pressure wasn't coming down even on meds and we discovered the  reason: I was diabetic. So I needed an app to track both BP and BS concurrently to watch for  correlations. So surprised to find how few apps do both! And before mySugr - none of them did it well! This is the perfect app for diabetics and especially those, like me, who need to track their BP as well. It's easy, all your entries can be made on one screen. And entry options not only include BP and BS but also meds, food, activity notes,etc. And the cute little rewards and cheers are actually fun and motivating- even for a 52 year old. After a month I was sold on this app and upgraded to premium. Well worth it! Very excited to now be able to set reminders and take food pictures to speed up my entries and guarantee I won't forget to take my meds and do my Glucose tests! Wish I could give mySugr MORE than 5 stars!

title: MUST HAVE for parents!
body: Our son was just diagnosed with Type 1 diabetes, and we found this app about two or three weeks after diagnosis. We tried out a few other apps, but this is by far the best one we've found. We upgraded to the paid version, and any caretaker can input data on any device and it synchs without problem. While I'm at work I can see what his sugars are running and how much insulin he has needed. We use this with the mysugr jr app, and the data transfers between both. The little monster guy is cute, my son named it, and he can tickle it and make it talk. So there are features that parents love, and the kids enjoy. You can even pick a date range to create reports and e-mail or print for doctor visits.

title: Amazing!!
body: My 2 year old son was newly diagnosed with type 1 diabetes. We had tried several other apps to log his blood sugars. One app we had a hard time syncing with and emailed for support and still to this day have gotten no response. We immediately looked for another app and stumbled upon this one. We love how eat it is and that we can each add info and the other can see it right away without having to sync it. We have even emailed with suggestions and got a thank you email within an hour! We love that there are reports that you can view and email to your doctor. It's such a simple and easy app too. I know once my son gets old enough he'll be able to enter in his own info once he's in school. Definitely worth the full purchase of the app!!

title: Best diabetes tracking app BY FAR!!!
body: My wife and I use this app to track our seven-year-old's  numbers so it is critical that the app stays synced between our phones to accurately keep him in range. We've NEVER had a problem with logbook not syncing (unlike other free apps). We switched to this app about a year ago and instantly loved it. The new update is even better, well worth the cost of the pro version.

title: The updates keep getting better.
body: I have always loved the application since I started using it last summer (2014), and every time there's an update, it keeps getting better. This last update was the best because it added more variables that I can keep track of as to why I might have low or high blood sugar, such as allergies! for the past few months I've been saying I feel sick instead of allergies which can be confusing already. I really like the correction insulin feature too so I can distinguish between my food and correction amount.

title: Best app I've found for diabetes management
body: I have gestational diabetes, and I've tried several different apps. I particularly like MySugr Logbook because it allows me to track with photos as well as food types and descriptions, it lets me easily export my data for my doctor to view, and I can set up reminders (in the paid version) to check my post prandial blood sugar. There are challenges built in that keep me motivated to track everything, and that data has helped me determine how to control my sugar through my diet.

title: Best app for my diabetes control
body: I seldom write reviews but I am so impressed with this app that I feel compelled to. I've tried pretty much all the apps for diabetes and I always come back to this one. It's easy to use and making entries is hassle free. Thus, I tend to consistently record all the pertinent data. Because of the visuals (graphs, etc.) I find that I analyze my control and am able to make adjustments on a more consistent basis. Since starting to use this app, my control has improved considerably and I've dropped a full 3 points on my A1c. The development team is also continually tweaking it and making improvements. The diabetes monster is also a fun (albeit silly) component. I highly recommend this app!

title: Pros and cons
body: I love this app because it's both interactive and informative. It's fun to keep the sugar monster at bay. I am more willing to log my carbs and such because of the little guy. And also, it gives me a good look as to how my actions affect blood sugar.

title: Best App for Diabetics!
body: Without question this is the best diabetic app on the market. I have managed to lower my A1C as a result of it. I am careful to track all my food and blood sugars, and this app makes it very easy to see trends. I've been able to adjust my basal rates on my pump to fine tune my numbers. I purchased the "pro" version after one day!

title: The Only Diabetic app you need!!
body: I downloaded this app the day I was diagnosed and have kept track of my blood glucose (BG), carbs, exercise, and so much more ever since.  This app provides a team that are here for you if you have any questions. I love how it graphs your BGs and does all the statistics for you.  I have used this to print PDFs for my endocrinologist and dietitian to look at my progress. You can set alarms to remind you to check your BG.  It also has optional daily, weekly, and monthly challenges to motivate you to exercise more and live more healthy.  This company also has other apps that can help educate you in diabetes through videos and fun quizzes.  I highly recommend this app to the newly diagnosed, parents, friends, and loved ones!!

title: You can't improve what isn't tracked
body: This is the most simple and thorough logbook I've used, it is integrated with HealthKit, it can be synchronized with CGM data. Sign up for the weekly emails because even if you fall off the boat, you're reminded every Sunday that you're not keeping up with your logs, you're congratulated if you are. It's everything you need in a diabetes app. I tried the paid coaching($20/mo promo), but I am already lucky enough to have some of the world's best cars with my diabetes team. This was redundant for me, but if I had lesser care and lived in an area without research hospitals around, it would be a godsend. The pro version of the app can be unlocked by simply using the app with a challenge, so it's totally worth it to use the app. I cannot recommend this enough.

title: Can't Live Without It.
body: As parents of a tween type 1 diabetic we constantly walk the tightrope between allowing our child to make choices and take responsibility for her care and making sure that she is doing so in the best way possible. This app is well worth the pro price. It is the only way that we have been able to successfully allow our young daughter to track her bg and allows us to monitor everything without feeling like we are hovering. The downloadable logs are incomparable in their ease for taking to the dr. And we were able to get her log without the fight or "forgetfulness" the paper logs used to inspire. This app is our family's "can't live without".

title: Best app for diabetics out there
body: Probably the best diabetes app I've found, you're able to actually challenge yourself, set goals and reminders that help you stay on track. On top of that you can access logs on their website from a pc and print out amazingly formatted log sheets for your doctor. Now if only it could link with my meter.

title: Clean, stylish, but lacking
body: This app makes keeping track of blood glucose levels super easy and fun. Most competitors look really cheap, while this app looks like it's had some care put into it. I think this is more focused for folks with type 2 diabetes, but it obviously still works fine for type 1. Even the print outs of the logs look really neat and professional. The main thing I wish was present was the ability to make a print out for different averages during the day. For example I wish it could give you averages for the last month of "before breakfast" and "after breakfast". I find myself having to go manually do the math for my doctor for things like that. This would be 5 out of 5 if they would just add that in.

title: Worth the extra $$
body: This is by far is the most user-friendly and attractive Diabetes app I've ever used. I'm T2 and insulin dependent, and paying the few extra dollars a month makes it so much easier to track all my numbers. I love how they added bi-weekly and monthly reviews with the new update, which helps me to get an idea of my average numbers without blood tests at the doctor.  I'm more than willing to pay extra for an app so that the developers can continue to improve an already great product!

title: Great app
body: I downloaded the app kind of suspicious that I would have to buy stuff. But that's not the case! It is great for keeping up on my diabetes. Yeah you do have to add the stuff in but you can print off what you've done and take it to your doctor. I appreciate that. I do wish we could earn stuff with good blood sugar with like movie tickets or gift cards to get things other than food. That would be awesome!

title: Great detailed app that syncs with Apple Health
body: I'm not a diabetic but I like to be in tune to my body and how it's feeling. I think that my blood sugar really strongly plays a role in how I feel, so I like to check my sugar both regularly and when I'm feeling some sort of way. This app is great for that because you can add so many details and see how they related to different glucose levels. It's really helped me feel better because I can identify what makes my body feel bad and stop it so I can feel more comfortable and be healthy. I have a strong genetic history of diabetes in my family so it's also nice to monitor myself and know that my body is running normally. I also love that it syncs with Apple Health

title: Great app. Simple but many features
body: You can use as much or as little of the app as you want. The main screen is a dashboard that shows a graph of blood sugars that is color coded. You can quickly look at trends. Another nice feature is that you can disable the sound. GPS is a great idea but it needs work- I didn't see a way to add landmarks, and it would be nice to have that ability since some landmarks are preloaded. It would be neat if there were a corresponding desktop app where you could upload directly from the meter over USB. Mysugr might have something that covers this already but I didn't see it in this app- if it's there I missed it. Great app though!

title: The Wonder BSL Tracker App
body: Having IDDM for 35 years, this App is amazing. It's easy, fuss free. The built in features, such as the approx HbA1c, is incredible. It's a motivator for me personally,to keep pushing through the little challenges each day. Now I see those little challenges, not challenges at all. Before using this friendly / encouraging App, those little challenges would cause me to throw the towel in so to speak. I'm honest with my notes and aim to be as accurate as I can be,calculating my carbs / insulin / exercise, and working with my incredible Dr. We are aiming to bring my bsls down to basically a non diabetic bsl and keeping in mind my safety first. My results in a week are incredible. Awesome/ brilliant/ motivator in disguise!!!!

title: Best diabetic app ever!
body: This app is a life changer! It makes it SO simple to track and control your sugars. I've been a type one for 22 years and i have never been good about taking care of myself - this app has helped me make so many positive changes in regards to my diabetes and eating habits! I  can't say enough good things about it.... the challenges are a fun way to get you to do what needs to be done and the point system makes you feel rewarded for tracking your sugars. I would recommend this app to any diabetic out there, after using it for a couple weeks it was a no brainer to pay for the pro version!!!! It's WELL worth the money! I love this app!!!

title: Great App
body: I was using the Diabetes Kit App, which literally was driving me crazy.  They kept working on it, but it never did become a user friendly App.  This is SO much better!! It works with my Fitbit, Apple Watch, Sync Solver, and my Apple Health.  Graphics are fun and there are many automatic features picked up out of my other installed apps.  I highly recommend it and wish I had signed up a year ago!

title: record keeping fun ?!
body: This app has made it so easy for my husband and I to record and analyze our sons trends. Love the instant analysis telling me average BS in 1, 7, 14 and monthly averages as well as how easy it is to produce and print data for the doctors. My boys (and I) always get a kick out of tickling the diabetes monster. It just makes us smile and laugh - who doesn't need that. I'd recommend it to anyone. My only suggestion for improvement would be to add a food bank and scanner option like my fitness app (and other food apps) use. I get a little tired of always having to repeatedly type in the foods he eats.  A bank of recently eaten foods would help a lot. Even so, this app is the best out there!

title: Absolutely perfect app!!!
body: There are never any bugs first of all-huge plus! I am 26 years old and use this app almost 10x/day because it helps track everything. The reports are awesome and I can look back and find out why I got low or hi at any time. My A1C used to be 10.5 consistently and after my first 3 months with this awesome tracking tool I finally got my diabetes under control and my most recent A1C was 7.6! This app is fun and easy to use and I've recommended it to all my T1 friends :) please keep it up this app has helped me turn my LIFE around!!! I am so thankful I found this after trying out several others. :)

title: Great app
body: We have been using this app since our daughter was diagnosed with T1D Thanksgiving of 2013. It is an invaluable tool that has made our adventure into the diabetes world bearable. The ability to keep all care takers (my daughter is 3) in sync makes keeping track of her diabetes a breeze. Our endocrinologist is always impressed with the robust reports we provide them because it allows them to spot trends in her BG that may have otherwise gone over looked. This app doesn't just log your diabetes info. It has become a necessary component to controlling our daughters diabetes! Special thanks to the devs for helping make our lives easier!

title: Bring back the analysis feature
body: I really loved this app until the latest update and now I think it's just okay. I think it's more difficult to enter information now since it's more spread out and there's more scrolling, and I HATE that the analysis feature is no longer available. I used my a1c to determine how close I was to the analysis and was pleasantly surprised by the results. It was incredibly motivating to see what my 7 day, 14 day and monthly averages were and I wish it was still available. I do like the fact that food and correction bolus are now separate, but since my carb ratio is 1:10 it's always pretty easy for me to see how much is going to food. Overall I do like this app, I just liked it a lot better prior to the latest update.

title: Most helpful app on my phone
body: We found this app the next day my 4y daughter got diagnosed. And we was lucky to use it. It has everything we need to log and every details the doctors said to record is included in this app and even more. Sharing the subscription between me and other devices even the web interface made adding and follow up easier. The option of setting a reminder very helpful within the daily stress in the beginning. Having meals, snakes and correction flags helped in adjusting the doses.

title: Easy to use and fun!
body: I was diagnosed with Type 2 diabetes in late March 2016 and did research into available apps that could help me track my BG. MySugr is the app I finally settled on because it allows me to track not just my BG but it provides a lot of options about my mood, before/after meals, bedtime, etc. this feature is unique to MySugr as far as I can tell! It's also fun because I want to beat the Monster each day and earn those points by tracking BG, taking pictures of my food, and entering other information such as medications and/or insulin. I like this app a lot because it allows me to keep tabs on my disease and have fun while doing so.

title: Love the concept
body: I love the concept of how this is program is pretty easy to use. Has taken me about 30 days to use this app to learn how to customize the tiles. Love it even more now! The reports that print out are really easy to read and the estimated A1c gives you encouragement to continue to tame the glucose monster. My Dr. Really likes the graphs and print outs as I am able to send to his email just prior to my appointment and he has time to analyze the numbers to make adjustments in the regimen he needs to for tighter control. My only wish is that the app had a place to record meals as well for a full picture. Have to use a separate app for that.

title: Your Diabetes Survival Companion!
body: Hearing I had diabetes made my head spin. I felt instantly overwhelmed by all I had to learn to help control it. Then I discovered mySugr. This app took all the hard stuff of monitoring and managing diabetes and made it simple and (dare I say) fun.

title: Major Help
body: When I started using this app a few weeks ago I wasn't monitoring my bloodsugars and my a1c was 9.6. I'm a teenager that's constantly on the move and always rushing from one place to another, frequently forgetting to monitor my sugars. This app has motivated me to keep checking, because it's so easy and has shown such a visible change in my numbers. It doesn't hurt that you earn points for logging in detail and have a little cartoon mocking you all the time. It makes a not so fun disease a little brighter each day!! My a1c now goes anywhere between 6.9-7.1 the lowest it's ever been!! Thankful for this app.

title: Great motivator
body: EDIT: Now the scanner isn't working.  I don't know if there was an update or what, but what was a really neat app is slowly becoming not so neat.  The sounds got taken away and now scanner issues.  A real bummer. :(

title: Ratio Setting is Not a Problem!
body: It looks like based on some previous ratings, some people didn't fully understand this app.  I believe the setting they were confused about actually is NOT an Insulin:Carb ratio but rather one for insulin exchanges (used by diabetics in Europe as well as here in the US many years ago). I found this explanation in the mySugr website FAQ.

title: makes tracking your diabetes easy and fun
body: I tried tracking my blood sugar and carbs just by carrying a notebook with me, but it was an abysmal failure all the time--I'd forget the notebook itself, or forget to use it. MySugr lets me be a success, because the push reminders, fun interface that I want to use, and it lives in my phone which I always have with me. Plus the challenges are fun and motivating, the diabetes monster is cute, it gives you weekly/etc averages, and you can export the information out to play with in your own spreadsheets, or just as an attractive PDF to bring to appointments with your health care team.

title: Quick, and has been developed by diabetics!
body: Flexible, you can go back and change your entries. Fast, makes good use of device resources, you are there and done. Tech is handled, the details of connecting (or not) are seamless as is syncing across devices. Calls a spade a spade, diabetes is a complicated monster. I have been diabetic for over 30 years and have used all kinds of approaches to gather data. This product brings big-data together for a easy to use highly motivating solution to monitor and track diabetes. In my first month I am really liking this and the support from mySugr.

title: Love mySugar & Little Monster!❤️
body: Great app to keep up with your BS, meals & exercise. Has so many features, easy instructions on website, little challenges to try to keep you on your toes and love the little monster you can name yourself! It makes me smile every time I push his tummy! Very easy to use and they send you your report each week!   Have tried others and nothing compares to this one. Sent suggestions and they got back with me immediately to say they are working on many new features to come and great hearing from users out there!   Thanks and keep up the great work guys! 👍

title: Great app!
body: I was hesitant to start using an app, thinking it would be easier to track data the old fashioned way - via paper and pen. I have become a believer! This app is very user friendly and has made it extremely easy to input daily glucose levels, carbs eaten, insulin dosage as well as other info - and it's all in one convenient place. We have multiple users on our account, allowing all caregivers to view data even if they aren't physically there. I recommend this app for anyone looking to simplify their life with tracking all the details that come with Diabetes.

title: So far it's amazing
body: I was on FB and saw a post about a new meter that connects to iPhones and upon further research I found this app. Being a Type 1 for 11 years I am always looking for new ways to keep myself in check with this disease. Being a typical teenager and having my phone constantly at my fingertips I think I found my newest solution for now. I have only been using this app for a couple days but it is user friendly, very interactive and it is fun and enjoyable to use which will really make a difference for me. I highly recommend this for any diabetic that is struggling or not.

title: Gestational Diabetes
body: Recently diagnosed with gestational diabetes. I don't have normal type 1 or type 2, and I was looking for an app to keep track of my stats where I could also export to email to my doctor.  This app seemed to fit.

title: Very useful tool
body: Got this app to help me track what foods were raising my blood sugar, and learned some things you don't get in books that are specific to my sugar levels. (Whole grains spike my blood sugar just like white bread) I could get this from any journal on my blood sugar, even one kept by hand, but here, the information is conveniently kept together, and can be combined with other apps I use to track my health. Plus it's always handy, because my phone is pretty much the only thing I always have with me.

title: Works well!
body: I like this. I'm happy to not have to write down my blood sugars or any notes. I can log everything I need in one place (meals, blood sugar, medications, notes).

title: Life changing app!!!
body: Being diagnosed with diabetes at the age of five, I was taught at a young age that logging my blood sugar, carbs, and insulin was very important. For a few years since I started high school I have found it difficult to monitor and record my diabetes but since I found this app it has personally changed my life. It has made logging my blood sugar super easy and convenient as well as given me reminder to check and log my blood sugar. Having had an a1c above 12 to now having an a1c below 7.8 I can say this app is a must have in this age. Thankyou mySugr look forward to what the future brings.

title: App Gives My Middle School Son Freedom
body: My 12 year-old is a newly diagnosed T1D. I am your typically over-protective mom, so sending him back to public school was tough. The sugar app allows me to check in on him while he's at school, and I'm at work. We both have the app on our phones; when he plugs his data in at lunch I can access it immediately. I don't have to worry which means he gets to do more. He had his first sleep-over since being diagnosed last weekend. I was able to see him trending low and texted him to eat some pizza so he wouldn't crash overnight. It's as close to normal as we can get.

title: Best app we have found for managing T1
body: I am thankful that we live in the time when diabetes management can be assisted by an application. In the four years we have been with this disease, we have tried countless apps to help us track numbers. MySugr  monster is the only app we have come across that gives us *almost* everything we need, in a Super fun user face that makes my child want to use it. Keep up the good work fellas!! (And if you feel like taking it one step further, my comment would be create a feature where adult gets texted when child enters glucose levels.)

title: Very easy and fun to use!
body: I gave up trying to find an easy to use app to track my son's diabetes management and stayed with a paper log. When I happened to see this app last week, I gave it a try and immediately loved it. Within 24 hours, my husband and son were also using the app on their devices. We have now upgraded to pro. I love the reports and analysis for spotting and fixing negative trends. I also really enjoy adding pictures of his meals and seeing those as I scroll through his log. My son enjoys the challenges. Absolutely, highly recommend this app!

title: Not as good as it used to be.
body: Being a young T1D my mom and I used this app to communicate about diabetes before the Dexcom Share came out. Now after taking a break from MySugr for quite awhile while we used Share, I decided to give this a try for when I check myself at nighttime. I was very disappointed to see that all of the things I used to be able to use like marking if I had a headache or if I was sick etc. we're all things I had to purchase now. My family already pays a lot for diabetes care and now it's another bill we could have to pay. I just miss the old app and I understand that MySugr needs the money to create more apps, but all this charging is quite excessive!

title: So encouraging
body: I used to be very complacent about managing my diabetes, until one day I went to the doctor and my HgA1c was very high. I started using this app and in just a month, it went down 2 points! This app is incredibly encouraging and interactive, it really keeps you motivated to keep logging. For me, just keeping better track of my numbers got me to take care of myself better. I had tried other logbook apps before, but felt that they were lacking in some way. This one is so thorough; it even takes my pump settings into account. I absolutely love mySugr!

title: Helpful
body: I find this app really helpful in it encouraging me to test my sugars as much as I really should. The biggest downfall I have is that as an insulin pump user, I wish there was a way to put in a negative insulin correction rate or a spot for insulin on board. It does tend to get a little confusing when putting in a carb/food insulin number and having to subtract for a lower than average sugar or when there is still active insulin in my system. This is important so that when I send the results to my doctor, she knows that I'm not using to much insulin due to the activity of it. Other than that, I don't have any complaints

title: Awesome and simple
body: I've been type 1 diabetic for a few years now, and I have a pretty good idea of how different foods affect my blood sugar. My main objective was to just keep track of the blood sugar itself, I don't really have an interest in tracking the carb amount since it is all pretty much the same. I feel like other apps pretty much force you to track all that extra info as well. This app gives you more freedom by letting you be as detailed as you'd like, not to mention it is great with keeping you motivated to keep your numbers within the healthy range.

title: Gestational Diabetes
body: I have Gestational Diabetes and wanted an app to track stuff. The free version is useless. There is no food data base (which a lot of other apps have for free or for a small fee). This app charges $2.99 a month. Forget it.

title: Great start - needs a few more features
body: The app is very easy to use. Looking forward to seeing a few specific features: auto complete for food and medicine logging; integrated carb, calorie, and food data based on inputs, better/more accurate mapping function (for some reason I'm continually at a restaurant down the street), more standardized feelings and food types, additional medicine/pill logging selections (e.g.: Trulicity, simvastatins) with pill weight included in set up instead of on input screen.

title: Going Pro
body: As a diabetic of over 8 years I really love this app. I was shocked and surprised when I saw all the functionality and options, like how it knew every glucose monitor and pump I've ever used. Most apps for diabetes management I'd seen before didn't know the difference between type 1 and 2, didn't even touch gestational, or were horribly outdated.

title: Even my Dr. Was impressed!!!
body: I love the ease of this app! It is simple and easy to use yet covers everything I need in a log book. I also love that i can print out my reports and give it to my Dr. to review and compare with my pump reports. I just went to my Dr.s and she loved how I could look up every test and tell her exactly what I ate, amount of carbs, and my insulin rate! She took down the info and said she would share this with others!!!! Thanks for a great app! The only way I could imagine this being better would be if it could look up food counts! :)

title: Awesome App!
body: Really easy to use! I love the alarm feature because it's difficult for me to remember to check my blood sugar 2 hours after meals. I also like being able to take a picture of my meal within the app because My doctor/dietician can see my portion sizes. I can also go back and add information later if I need too. A few things I would like added are: 1. The ability to add my weight. 2. A place to add water/drink in ounces. 3. More or unlimited note taking space. This is by far the best app I have found for helping me manage my diabetes. Great work! I am looking forward to future updates.

title: Best app for diabetes out right now
body: Been looking for a diabetes tracking app for the last year, and this one does everything I need it to and is actually fun to use. Some of the apps out there are not user friendly, ugly or the developer has stopped supporting it (even though its still for sale). You can do all your tracking with the free version, though the nice pdf reports come with the pro version. The challenges and ability to "defeat" your diabetes monster on a daily basis is a nice incentive to track things as well.

title: I love this app!
body: I am a diabetic for ten plus years (diagnosed at age 10) and I've never felt in better control of my blood sugar. It so well organized and gives you both a quick and detailed idea of how you are doing with your numbers. Having such a well functioning app has encouraged me to keep track of my numbers and what I eat (on top of so many other things this app offers). I also notice you can print out your logbook and records which will be super handy when I visit my endocrinologist next!

title: The first diabetes app I've actually enjoyed
body: I highly recommend this app. I have t1d, have tried so many other apps for tracking apps and this is by far the best one.

title: Helpful...
body: I have type 1 diabetes and this app is helpful to use for managing diabetes, and has more features than a regular paper log book, however it bums me out that you have to pay to use more features within the app, like paying for a pdf report. I downloaded this app when it first came years ago and I was able to use all of the features like taking photos of your meal but I guess since it has become more popular I can't do that anymore unless I upgrade. People with diabetes already pay enough for medical supplies, wish we got let off the hook for once!

title: A God-send App
body: This app is helping me to keep track of my daily sugar numbers.

title: Happy sugar slaying
body: I found this app after an unexpected diagnosis of type 2 diabetes on a Friday afternoon by a health professional who was not able to give me guidance, just scary numbers. Armed with a glucometer and the internet I was fortunate to find this app! The app helped me get started treating my diabetes with confidence (well at least with records to help me later). It's easy to use. The free version has served as the Best one place to input data. I used it to input my blood sugar levels, number of carbs I am eating, foods, meal descriptions, tracking medications. Which for me helps a ton.

title: So helpful!
body: Stop reading and download already!!! I am a newly diagnosed type 2 diabetic. I was so overwhelmed and scared when I got the news. This app is fantastic. It's friendly and you get great email and in app support from fellow diabetics. It's super easy to keep a log this way and it sends you a weekly report summarizing everything. That's all with the free version!!! The developers have a good sense of humor which really helps cope with this especially when you first get started. Very user friendly. Get it!!  You won't be disappointed

title: AWESOME!!
body: Hands down 🙌🏽 this is the BEST app around. I've tried others and they don't come close to this. I also love the reminder feature along with ALL the possible scenarios that can happen throughout your day that you add to your log book. Definitely worth the money, I chose the annual route. FINALLY an app where I feel someone understands what I need and addressed them to help me control that Monster (Diabetes) 😉👍🏽👊🏽👏🏽👏🏽👏🏽

title: Great to have an app like this
body: When our four-year-old son was diagnosed with type one, none of the physicians or staff had any recommendations for us on any apps we could use to help manage his diabetes so exploring on my own I came across this and a few others.  This is usually the most intuitive and comprehensive and fun app I came across and strongly recommend it. The only thing that would make it even better would be an integration of something like CalorieKing so that you can manage even more closely

title: MySugr, an app for diabetes that you'll want to use!
body: It is really easy to use and fun; I never thought I'd say that about an app for diabetes! It allows you to track not only your blood sugar but also carbs, long and short acting insulin, exercise, emotions and best of all, it shows the trends and averages of your blood sugar levels. This app not only helps you keep your sugar in check, but can also help you understand how different foods affect it. I absolutely love it! By far the best $20 bucks I've spent at the App Store! I highly recommend it!

title: Lifesaver Literally
body: Being a recently diagnosed diabetic, I've struggled finding motivators to keep checking my blood levels. This app not only keeps me motivated and allows me to keep valid numbers of my sugar levels, but allowed me to impress my doctors. With my printed out levels color coded and notes I was referred to as the "dream patient". This app has allowed me to educate my children as well in a fun way to get them to eat better. My daughter (just turned 2) reminds me to check my sugar monster. Thank you for all the work you are doing!

title: love this app
body: this app is amazing. love the color coding and way it shows info and love the reports that i can give my doctor. as a diabetic that uses injections, its invaluable.

title: A must for diabetics
body: Love this app. Helps me stay accountable for the things that matter most -- taking insulin, meds, common sense eating, etc.  It is not a program that is detailed about food content (carbs, protein, quantities, etc), but there is enough to keep you towing the line in that Dept. If you have basic knowledge about glycemic index and portion control. I love the fact that I can email results to my diabetic nutritionist and Doctor. Also found the customer service to be AAA+ when I had questions early on about how To use the app.

title: I love it!!!
body: I have had type 1 diabetes since I was 5 years old and I am now 18. I have ALWAYS struggled with this disease and I have hated it more and more as I have gotten older. This app has been a help to me. I am not on the pump and my doctors say I need to test my blood sugars at least 4 times a day and I have had a lot of fun with this!!! I don't have a support system or anything like that, so having an app on my phone has been the biggest support that I have gotten in years. 😭☺️☺️☺️ I absolutely love it. Thank you for creating this app!!!!

title: Monster Makes Diabetes Easier
body: This is the easiest and most enjoyable way to track diabetes' data...yes, that's possible. The program lets user customize what data fields are wanted...blood glucose, food, exercise, carbs, etc. Reports are generated for the user...no tedious paper and pencil, calculators, etc. Screen data fields are in different colors for troublesome or target zones.  Simple to use and to understand....Best of all--the "Monster" giggles or makes other appropriate sounds when data is entered.  Brings a smile to the face...even your own giggle.

title: Helpful and fun
body: Getting diagnosed with gestational diabetes sucked. All the tracking and poking and rearranging my life around my eating schedule has been hard. This app not only gives me a single location to keep all my tracking notes, it gives me a little smile as my sugar monster giggles and "noms" in response to every entry. It's amazing what that little bit of positive feedback does to brighten my day. And my nutritionist was very happy to have so much information at her fingertips when I handed in my two week report.

title: Very Helpful
body: I've been using the app for about a week now. It came in very handy when I talked to my doctor and could just show her what my numbers had been. I love how it links with Apple Health. So everything records to keep track of everything I do. If there is a spike in my sugars, I'll be able to see what may have caused it and share with my doctor at future visits if she needs to know. I would recommend this app for anyone dealing with diabetes. Whether newly diagnosed or have been diabetic for years.

title: Easy for tracking!
body: I'm borderline diabetic and tracking my sugars in an effort to see what foods/behaviors work best for me. MySugr is an easy way to keep all my info in one place. I also enjoyed the weekly report I received via email. Of note, I was a bit frazzled when I couldn't see my A1C estimate before realizing you have to input 21 readings in a week before the estimation is given. I typically test twice a day, so this may not be a feature I use, but I am satisfied with the ease of use and will continue to use the app.

title: Very cool
body: I've been using this app for a while now (was lucky enough to be an alpha tester) and I highly recommend it. The released version is even better than the version I tested. Plain and simple, my numbers improved because the app encouraged me to pay closer attention to managing my diabetes. The reports are very good and the usability/interface of the app is what you would expect from brand new software. I am very pleased and excited about this app. I'm a type 1 diabetic 25 years and counting.

title: Tags
body: When i made entries and went back to review them, there would be tags shown that i didnt mark, double tags (ie: two lunch tags) in an entry and i would change them, but when i went back to review, id have to fix the tags all over again. Ugh. The report tab would freeze the app; i got very flustered. The support team members were prompt in returning my emails, very helpful and kind! Besides these tag issues, this app is WONDERFUL! It helps you manage your condition; turns diabetes difficulty into endocrinology ease! Just fix the tag issue :) 4 stars ****

title: Best diabetes app
body: I decided to test out a few diabetes apps to compare. This is the best one. Super easy, user friendly. Simple way to put in your numbers and insulin amounts. I love the points system. It's a fantastic motivator, I love the ability to say what I've been doing and how I'm feeling. It makes tracking trends easy.

title: Awesome
body: Easy to use. Creating a new logbook entry is quick. With this app I am keeping track of much more than I ever have before. Because this app is so simple to use, there is now a lot of information available to me with minimal effort. I can see bad patterns in my day to day routine, single them out and correct them. I can see good results as well ;) This app makes logging the information very easy and then makes that information available in a straight forward concise manner. Awesome!

title: Really like this app but still needs work
body: Well, I've been living with the update now and I ABSOLUTELY HATE that you guys took away the monthly averages. Plus all my pics were deleted that I had used before. What the heck! I feel like I'm unprepared going to my next endo appointment not having pertinent info to calculate my A1c on my own - really really frustrated. Already downloaded a new app to try instead of this one. It may not have the cute monster but at least the info is readily available.

title: Easy App to use
body: I have been a Type 1 juvenile diabetic for 55 years.  This app so far is very helpful to me in order to record the time I test, my blood sugars, carbs, high blood sugar insulin corrections, the food I have eaten, the average and being able to send the information on too my Endocrinologist.  I can keep track of everything in one spot and one device. I love it. Thanks!

title: A few upgrades would be nice--but overall, a great app
body: PLEASE ADD COFFEE AS AN OPTION FOR FOOD CONSUMED! I know I'm not the only diabetic who has spikes from coffee. I was hoping the app would give me a better sense of coffee effects' timeline and intensity, but I have to relegate "coffee" to notes or chalk it up as a "supplement"/diet soda (but diet soda doesn't spike me...). It would also be great if there were autofill options for recent/typical user foods. Otherwise, it's a fab app--I highly recommend this to any diabetic trying to make logging really easy and trackable.

title: Loving it
body: I have been using this App for about a month after trying different glucose logging Apps. I found this App simple, fun, and helpful. I had a recent appointment with my endocrinologist and was able to show her my readings and she was impressed with it as well. The only problem I have is that I can't log my exercise because it is not user friendly with my misfit shine which logs my walking daily. I normally don't write reviews but I love this App and check my glucose readings several times daily.

title: T1D
body: I LOVE this app!!!  Now that I purchased the annual Pro, I can take pics easily, which makes it fun!  I especially like the data export option in Pro.  I will be able to print out the sheet for myself, and compare it to the doctors!  I am not tech savvy, but I am hopeful that once I have all the CGM, pump, and Verio iQ equipment, I will be able to figure out how to connect it all!  Great job!  I would definitely recommend this to a friend, and I think that because it is such a great app, your workers needs more than just ONE Diet Coke =)

title: Best I Could Find
body: As a newly diagnosed Type 2 diabetic, this was the best app I could find for tracking and pinpointing trends to help manage my BS. Pretty easy to use and love that it is compatible Apple Health.  I've used "Lose It" for awhile for food entries so I'm comfortable entering meals on that app with the data syncing. Unfortunately MySugr logs a time of 11:59pm for every entry coming from LoseIt requiring an edit on all entries. I would highly recommend to anyone. Not a fan of requiring a subscription - would rather have a flat fee.

title: Snoopervising
body: Love this app for helping my 13 y/o daughter keep on track with her BG. I can see what she's doing at school and then text for things like setting a temp basal or editing her logs and adding a reminder.

title: Nice diabetes app
body: I love this app. They make it easy to record glucose levels, make graphs, record food intake, activity levels, how I'm feeling, and much more. I would give it a 5 star except they don't allow type 2 oral meds and other meds, only insulin. If they would add features for type 2 diabetics also, hands down this would be the greatest app. I would love to see them add type 2 meds as well as any other meds that a person may take, blood pressure readings, lab results such as A1C, cholesterol, lipids, etc. This way you have a record of medical history as well, in case of an emergency.

title: Very motivating and easy
body: Makes diabetes management convenient and entertaining. As a graphic designer, I love the interface design and the clever monster character.  Great logbook analysis reports and long term feedback. Response from support/staff is prompt and friendly!

title: Great Tracking App
body: This is a great app to help track blood sugars and start to look for patterns in numbers. It gives you an average blood sugar so you can kind of get an idea of what your a1c is going to be. I love that I don't have to carry around a log book and that I can log what I've eaten with the app as well-- the basic version doesn't give calories (don't know if the pro version does either) but being able to put all my info in one app is seriously time saving.

title: Eh?
body: This was recommended as an easy to use & understand app.  I'm not diabetic, but my doctor noticed that twice when I was doing a course of steroids for an autoimmune disease, my blood sugar rapidly climbed above 200. The 3rd time, we decided to add both a medication and testing.  This app was chosen so I could dump data in Apple Health which allowed me to email weekly results.  I can still put the data in Apple Health, but reports now cost, as do all the other previously free features.  It is decent at its purpose, but if there were something else that accepted Apple Health data that I already use, I don't think I would use this.

title: User Friendly and FUN!
body: The app is pretty easy to figure out, and a lot of fun to use. The monster does help make logging things in a little less tedious as well as giving you something to smile at. It definitely is more specifically a diabetic app then a Health app, so if you're looking for something that tracks all of your nutrition values of foods or will look them up for you, this is not it. Go into it knowing that it is to help track your diabetic stuff and you will be happy!!

title: Just Right for Me
body: I've had Type I diabetes for almost 50 years. Keeping a good log has never been easy, but since I found this app, I've been perfect at it. I don't use the additional info tracking like exercise and food at this time, because all that is second nature to me, but I love the way my daily numbers are both averaged and graphed. It's so fun to use, I stay motivated to keep a record and analyze the results. To my amazement, my bgs have improved considerably!  Thank you!

title: My Sugr App
body: I'm totally impressed with this app. It incorporates the whole person and gives me a report I can take in to my doctor. The sound effects mimic exactly what I'm feeling. They make me laugh and people always ask "What was that?"  It gives me the opportunity to tell people about this wonderful app.

title: I love it
body: I have been diagnosed for 18 years now. I have never enjoyed having to log stuff, until now. For once I am finding it not so tedious I lose focus in keeping up with my numbers.

title: Incredible!
body: I've had type one for ten years and have never enjoyed the day to day "high maintenance" lifestyle of being type one. Having this app is a fun way to be able to log all of your sugar levels and see an estimated A1C. After being careless for a while, trying to get back into being as healthy as possible has been challenging, but tracking my diabetes has been a breeze with this app. It's also super cute, which makes things more fun! 5 stars for mySugr!!!

title: Best one I've used so far
body: I like the cute little monster. I wish I could do more with her. I like the incentive of points to keep me logging my sugars. Something my old notebooks couldn't do. I also like that it changes color depending on my readings. Makes it easier to see when my diabetes isn't doing so good.  In 15 years of pricking my finger & keeping food journals this is one of the best I've come across. If I had more diabetic friends I'd recommend this to them. Thumbs way up 👍👍

title: Great App!
body: This is the first app made for tracking diabetes that actually keeps doing so interesting. It's hard to forget to check your sugar and track your eating when there is this much excitement involved. It's a lot like playing a game with the point system and it really gives you something to reach for. This would be especially great for young teens and even children, but even at age 23 I find myself sucked into it. Such a wonderful idea!

title: Use it for Gestational Diabetes
body: I am not a 'typical' diabetic that has to track a lot of numbers so I was looking for something easy to use to get me through the rest of my pregnancy. I love that this app is free, but can be upgraded if you need more help. I can take pictures, keep notes on my food and activity, as well as track as often as I need. I am positive that if the diabetes is still an issue after delivery, I will be using this app as well as upgrading!

title: Perfect app
body: I love this app so much!! This has really helped me to see everything I need to know for any adjustments with doses and carbs and I am going to upgrade to the pro version which will then give me reminders to retest my sugars if I need with a time amount that works for me :-) the only thing that I think should change is options for different kinds of insulin than just long and short acting because some of us use mid acting insulin like NPH and such

title: Best App Ever
body: I've been a T1D for 11 years and have never found an app that really worked for me. This app not only helps me log, but it's really positive and the goals are awesome. It's nice knowing that I have a sympathetic monster when my blood sugar is high instead of the typical "what did you forget to do."

title: Very helpful and informative
body: This app helped me get my a1c down from 9.5 to 6.7. The data of hypos and hypers, deviation, and a1c are very organized and helpful. I encourage anyone with type 1 diabetes to get this app. I even told my doctor about it and she thought it was very useful and interesting. The only thing is I wish that there were more tags available for the free version, considering that most of them are for pro only. Overall though, very helpful app!

title: Literal life saver
body: This app is the best I've found for diabetes. I've had it for a while but decided I wanted better control after my eating habits changed. I'm type 1 and it lets me add notes about what I've had to eat, blood sugars and injection amounts. The biggest benefit for me is that I'm living abroad in Ireland where they use a different scale than in the states and the app can automatically switch it so I can show my doctor results in the format used in Europe. Love love love it!

title: Easy, quick, fun
body: I've tried several different methods of tracking and this is the only one that I can maintain. It would be nice if the reports had more options for what info is included and how it is displayed (currently the meal descriptions are tiny, but that is something my drs want to see most), but the reports do have a clever display and only take a moment to figure out. It is definitely NOT a detrimental feature that should deter you from this amazing app!

title: The Kid In Me!
body: I love this app. I love the reactions of the sugar monster and his noises. Even at 51 I need the extra incentives to take my sugars regularly. I am Type 2 but I have recently recommended this app to a friend whose 3 year old has been diagnosed.

title: Keeps tracking simple
body: I am a new to having type 2 diabetes. Tracking has been overwhelming.  MySugr has made it easy.  I snap a picture of what I eat and then can figure out my carbs later when I have a moment.  It makes me more aware of what I am eating.  I think it will be a big help in working with my doc. Since it was created by folks that also have diabetes they really have made something that works well.  Love the ease and thoroughness.

title: MySugr App
body: Incredible App that provides the motivation and the fun to test regularly. T2D for 10 years now and would always eyeball my state.  Rarely tested...maybe 4 times a year.  Came across the app and realized diabetes truly is a monster that needs to be tamed.  That coupled with A1C levels rising to Federal Aviation Authority max levels for me to maintain my pilots license and I was ready! Thanks to the developers of this app for providing a valuable and entertaining tool that is contributing so much to my well being!!'

title: Encouraging and coaxing
body: Not a newcomer to databases, I can appreciate that this little gem works as well for me as it might for someone new to keeping data. It provides encouragement and subtle coaxing to help you remember to test and record your glucose levels. The reporting options are certainly handy: the glucometer reader in my doctor's office was broken last visit and we reviewed the numbers instead on my phone with this app. I consider mySugr a "must-have" for my diabetes management!

title: By far best glucose app out there!
body: I have used countless apps for tracking my blood sugar and this how you do it! My favorite feature is the reminder I can set after eating. That was my biggest problem was remembering to check 2 hours after. Now cherry on top would be they make a glucose machine that connects Bluetooth and integrated with the app!

title: Love it!!
body: Makes doing what isn't so much fun a bit better. Can't wait to earn the pro edition to unlock some more features. My 8 yr old daughter has named her 'monster' and thinks all of his expressions and sounds are fun!  Makes tracking blood sugar easy!  My one recommendation would be to add in a carb counting feature that allows you to look up carb values for different foods - haven't found a good app for that yet and it would be nice to have an all-in-one app!

title: Life is sweet
body: 23 year old T1D and this has been the best source of motivation for me to test my blood sugar. The app helps me keep track of the patterns I have through the day and weeks to see what has caused my sugars to spike or crash. I love that I've been able to tame my little monster named "acceptance" everyday since I got the app. The app has also allowed me to see the symbolism of how I can be in control by taming my diabetes (or monster) that is always with me! It's wonderful!

title: Something new for me -- makes it easier
body: I have not used a glucose log in the phone, so my review really is not comparing it to others. But I like it a lot so far. It makes me more diligent than the previous method where l used notebooks and never really kept up.  The animation is great for kids, maybe an option to turn it off would be good (not really a deal breaker, more a recommendation). It is easy to use, does its job, and so far it has not broken anything down, it or other processes.

title: Great app and a few requests
body: This is a very good app. I have two requests. One, it would be great if it could record and average separately baseline (fasting) and postprandial numbers. I often want to know how high my number got after a meal, and this data messes up my pretty good baseline averages.

title: Kinda fun
body: Easy input and cheerful design. I was a little bummed that I got the Accu check meter that I thought was compatible and would get a free to ugrade but it was not approved in USA yet. The iHealth Gluco is the meter you want for USA. I decided to just pay the upgrade and do manual input. It's expensive but I'm happy with the app after a few weeks use. I wish it could interface with one of the carb counting apps.. And maybe exercise tracker one day too. Simple to use, good for youth or adult.

title: Love It!
body: I've been a long time Type 2 diabetic, but recently added insulin therapy. I was using a combination of other apps to track blood sugar readings, carb counts, blood pressure, and weight which has gotten tiresome especially when trying to export a cohesive report to give to my doctor. This app does wonders in tracking all of the above in one place and the PDF report export is a great feature. Definitely spring for the pro version upgrade.

title: Diabetics Life
body: It's not easy living a life with diabetes because we limit our selves to may delicious foods but with this app I was able to learn what to eat and what not to eat to keep my sugar levels in good range. It's easy and fun at the same time because you can monitor your progress and feel better with our self because you know you are making the right choices in life. I would recommend this app to those like me.

title: Great but needs a change.
body: This app looks amazing and very fun but they desperately need an update to it. In the settings they need to make the ratio more sensitive than merely 1unit for every 20 carbs. My personal ratio is 1 units for every 25

title: Great for Teens and Kids!!
body: Our teen is newly diagnosed type 1. This app has made logging glucose levels extremely easy! It's also eased much worry as we sent her to school the first few weeks of this diagnosis. As she would log her blood glucose while at school, my husband and I could monitor her levels, all while at different places during the day, since we are all logged on the same account. This app has given us piece of mind!

title: Fun and motivational.
body: I was diagnosed with type 1 two years ago and have tried to use non-diabetes focused apps to help me keep on track but they just weren't easy enough. This app is great. The monster theme is cute and silly. The challenges are achievable and the day to day tracking is easy and to the point. I've noticed an improvement in my average blood sugar since using this app for the last month. I highly recommend it!

title: Love this fun and helpful app!
body: This app makes logging my son's diabetes info fun and easy. I love the colors and the sounds (sweet and non-obnoxious).  Creating a PDF log is super easy.

title: Very nice app and easy to use
body: If you are new to diabetes or have had it for a while, this app is awesome. Just use this to input your information. Keeps your averages and let's you know informant information you need. Carb count, medications can be stored plus gives you fun challenges to work on. I used to have an issue using most apps or trying to keep track on paper, no longer will this be an issue. Thanks for the great app!

title: Good app for tracking Blood Sugar
body: I like this app since it is fairly easy to use and syncs data with the Apple Health app. I'm not as happy with the current version. It is now more difficult to use. It used to be intuitive, but now you need to search for things and entering test results is not as easy. Also, when installed, the default does not the option for entering meds taken. You have to goo to set-up and add it.

title: Wow, great app for diabetics
body: I was diagnosed with type II diabetes in early 2010. I started having a difficult time with my sugars several months ago. My doctor mentioned hearing about mysugr several weeks ago. I downloaded and started using the app and have been able to work with my doctor to adjust my diet and insulin to get the monster back under control. The interface is well organized and the animated monster makes logging fun.

title: Love 😍😍😍
body: I hav been waiting for a app like this. It's cute, fun and makes your log simple and organized then writing on paper I really wanna see what new features are in stored for this app only negative thing I wish they had a more detailed how to video or when u open the app it was a little confusing till I played around with this the first couple of days I wish they had a lock on the app so I could use finger print to unlock it

title: Stop looking and start logging
body: I've been type 2 for about 20 years and never took logging seriously because I wasn't taking short acting. Starting to use this app has given me direct awareness and ultimately control over my numbers. Using mysugr is easy and comprehensive. I can easily produce reports for my Endo.

title: Works so far
body: WHEN I use it, it helps keep me on track. The weakest part of it is my part! I've had it for a few years and the data as icons, game-like input, and comprehensive tracking keep me motivated to care for myself. Any data fields you're missing can be placed in the notes. And they've already explained why they need 3 tests per day to give you an A1C. I'm just hoping for a version where my blood sugars cross over by bluetooth.

title: Awesome app for diabetics
body: My daughter is T1 diabetic. This app is amazing! Easy to use, keeps up with all of her doses, moods, and any notes I need to share with her doctor to look for patterns to help with management. She loves to input her moods and the challenges are fun. The app exports the info in a way that is easy for her doctor to read. I've tried other apps and this one is by far the best. I hope there is a version available for windows phones soon as well.

title: Love this app!!!
body: I am a teenage girl with T1 diabetes, and I have been struggling to motivate myself to check my blood glucose regularly, which was having a negative impact on my health. I was getting desperate, and so I decided to give this app a try, thinking "hey, what's the harm"? I am so glad I did, because it's proven to be extremely helpful and motivating. It's helped me set goals for myself, and holds me accountable. If you are struggling with diabetes, and need a fun, motivating log book, this app is for you.

title: So much fun!
body: This is the only app I've tried that actually looked great! I love the design and it takes the app to the next level. You know a lot of time and thought by lots of talented people went into making this. Then the idea behind it is genius! Not only are you tracking your BG but this app makes it fun by motivating you to log your results by giving you points and rewards! I'd recommend this app to any diabetic!

title: engaging & easy to use
body: this app has got me tracking my blood sugar for the first time in years... plus my meals, snacks, exercise, and medication use. it's made keeping track of things fun, as well as informative. it also allows my partner to know what my blood sugar is when, and to keep track of what my day has been like. I "won" pro level for a few days and absolutely love it... I'll be buying it when I get my next paycheck!

title: Nice App
body: The app works as it says. However, the yearly fee is only to get a report.  The report could be better organized and provide more information.

title: Perfect App for logging for type 1 diabetes
body: I love this app so much. It's so great for keeping track of my health and my type one diabetes. I love being able to lock up my monster and when you do that it's called taming it. I also love getting to see my A1 C and I also love getting to see how many carbs are in my average over the last day week month or 90 days. I definitely suggest this app for anyone with diabetes looking for a Logbook app!!

title: Greatest Diabetes App Ever
body: This app is so motivational and encouraging to me that I use it frequently to help me manage and control my type 2 diabetes. The added A1c feature is a great help also just as a bonus. I do not remember how long I have been using this app but it has been a very long time and I have recommended it to everyone who I help in a diabetes support group that I am part of on the Internet for the last 2 years or so.

title: Taming my Monster
body: I am so entertained by this app! I love taking a picture of my meal - it makes me spend a little extra effort to plan and plate something lovely and delicious, which makes me feel good, not deprived. I named my monster Sleepy Carl, and can wait to see his mouth zipped each day! The reports are beautiful, the BGs are automatically color-coded, and the challenges are fun. After 15 years, I am reinvigorated with my logging. Thanks for making DM a little fun!

title: It was great until...
body: The past week, MySugar app keeps logging me out. Daily. We paid for the full version and I expect this to be remedied ASAP. Then, I'll update my review. Other than that, it's super user friendly allowing me to enter all necessary info on one page - even temp basal amounts for my 2 year old Type 1 diabetic daughter. Logging all her carbs, what she eats, bolus is so important because it helps me know where to adjust her I:C and why she dropped to low or spiked from what food and when. This app helps us manage her T1d along with her CGM and insulin pump.
response: HI! Thanks for your feedback and yes the logging out is super annoying. I am totally with you! BUT there is an update out (18th of May) where this bug should be fixed. Can you try to update the app and then you should not be logged out any more.

title: The best!
body: I love this app! It is fun at all ages and it is convenient, no more log book as it is always with me on my phone! And it does the statistics for you! I really do not believe their is a better more in-tune to diabetes app out their.

title: Best Diabetes Control App
body: I began using this app on February and to my amazement was contacted by the Co-Founder and their Communications Lead regarding my use of this app and my personal journey of Diabetes and my care.  They WANT and NEED YOUR INPUT to make this the best Diabetes Management app in the world.  Now if they would help us with a recipe link of diabetic recipes and and a carb counter for when your out and about on the go...best app out right now that I have used just about everyday since downloading

title: So far so good!
body: Happy with it so far.

title: Absolutely amazing!
body: I was just diagnosed with gestational diabetes. I'm seven months pregnant with my first child. I was so upset and anxious about keeping track of my levels until I found this app! My doctor was so impressed with it when I showed her that she is now recommending it to all her patients with gestational diabetes! I can't tell you how much of a difference it has made! The reporting and timers are the most helpful to me! Thank you so much!!

title: Great app but very disappointed for 20$
body: This app is very helpful, however for 20$ I must admit I expected a whole lot more.  Exercise needs to be linked to apple health so your daily steps and running are automatically logged and integrated.  The meal section could be improved exponentially.  Restaurant menus need to be integrated.  Food options with pre loaded carbs should be integrated.  Must admit been helpful, but a 20$ app should be much more complete

title: Just What I Needed
body: This app is a fun & great way to motivate me to tend to my blood sugars more consistently. Taming my diabetes monster, Fletchy McSugrcuddy, is the slight motivation I need. I can log my readings, enter meal info, take part in daily & weekly challenges tracking the amount of activities done, & there are fantastic tags. Analytics are provided that are exportable I can email straight to my doc & Diabetes Ed nurse, everything is searchable & there's too-notch customer support. Thanks for a GREAT app!

title: AMAZEBALLS
body: As I type 1 diabetic for 18 years I've had my shares of ups and down but since I've started using this app with all its user friendly options I look forward to logging everything from my pump site changes to dr appointment stats. I love how accomplished I feel after seeing all my green highlighted blood sugars and knowing my averages. I believe this app is the perfect tool for any diabetic looking for great apps to help with their journey.

title: Great app for a horrible disease!
body: I've had type I diabetes since I was 4 (over two decades), and was great at logging and taking care of diabetes until I left for college.  Since then, I've been pretty bad at counting carbs and looking for patterns.  Nine years later, this app and a healthy diet have helped me get back on the right path.  Thanks for the work you're doing, and if you got off the path like I did, download this app now!!

title: Totally awesome app!
body: This app has been great. A place to keep track of not only my crazy blood sugars, but my insulin shots, blood pressure, weight, a1c....I love having an alarm to set to remind me to check my blood sugar. I wish the method of tracking carbs was a little smoother. It won't let me enter when I go way over on my carbs, so if I've been bad I have to enter multiple times. I like getting the weekly update too. Best money I've ever spent on an app!!

title: Great App
body: I've been using the free version for quite a while and will continue until I have had a chance to review some of the other apps that are available for keeping track of my diabetic readings and so forth.

title: Good start
body: But only a start. In order to be more useful it should be integrated with the Apple health app. That will allow sharing of data and gathering of data with less effort and greater accuracy.
response: HI, thanks for your review! You already can connect mySugr to Apple Health ;) Just go into the side menu of mySugr and tap on "connections", there you could connect to Apple Health. If you have questions about it, just send a mail to support@mysugr.com :)

title: Love it!! Just what I needed.
body: I have to say that this has been the BEST app I have found so far.... I love being able to see on a graph what's REALLY going on with my

title: Love this app
body: All the recording features are great. Can use labels and indicate my own notes.

title: Great idea but buggy
body: When entering carbs, multiple entries are entered rather than just one. The only way to label by meal, mood, and enter notes is to simply enter the number of carbs then go back and edit the log. You should be able to enter everything one time without having a new carb entry for each icon or note.

title: Very helpful!
body: I've been using this app for a few days now, and I love it. I was looking for something relatively simple and this is just right. I didn't give it 5 stars because of two things: 1) I take several pills and want to be able to record them all in one log entry, but it will only let me record one. 2) there is one icon that I haven't figured out the meaning of. It would be helpful if there was a legend in the manual for things like that.

title: Super Good App! ❤️
body: I'm not tech at all and have a terrible memory. Being able to photograph my food helps me remember my carbs. The app has been easy to use, love the sounds, love the monster! Love the history and reports. Still trying to figure  out how to edit if I make an error. Love the security and official medical device status. Looking forward to an update soon that will allow blood pressure logging too.

title: App is Cool
body: I like the App. Very easy to use and very helpful and detailed. Works well. What I don't like (reason for 4 stars) is the point Earning to "tame the monster".
